Gammon Gambler turns your Apple into a tireless, skillful backgammon player. Whether you are new to the game or an expert sharpening your skill for that trip to Monte Carlo, Gammon Gambler is a challenging adversary at your level.

96751.name: Nugget
96751.description:
from the introduction:
NUGGET is a simple set of roleplaying game (RPG) rules. A group of people sit around pretending to be imaginary characters having adventures in a fictional setting. Each controls a player character (PC), except one who takes the role of Game Master (GM), setting up situations for the PCs and controlling the other characters they meet (non-player characters, NPCs). The players say what their characters do and the GM tells them what happens next. The story progresses through scenes of particular actions at a location. You'll need pencils and paper and about 10 six-sided dice.

user comment:
The Nugget rules are available as a free download from the publisher's site.

96752.name: Checker King
96752.description:
From the manual

Whether you are a novice learning to play checkers or an expert looking for a challenging opponent, Checker King will provide a capable and willing competitor.

96753.name: Beastwalkers
96753.description:
from the introduction:
This is a setting module for use with NUGGET, a trimmed-down version of the LODE system, available for download from www.silverbranch.co.uk. It's a sort of modern-day fantasy supernatural thingy. This module may evolve over time.

Werewolves? Pah! Sometimes you don't know whether to be angry that the humans have forgotten the rest of you, or glad that it gives you the breathing room to get on with your job.

You are a member of a strange breed, the Children of the Moon, the Beastwalkers; part human, part animal, part spirit, yet different from all. Your kind has always lived among humans - helping, harming, guiding, tricking, watching. Once you were better known. Now, in "civilised" places, both sides are happier if your existence is unsuspected.

user comment:
The Nugget rules are available as a free download from the publisher's site.

96754.name: The Grey Realms
96754.description:
from the introduction:
This setting is written as a somewhat tongue-in-cheek reworking of common fantasy elements, and would work well for a humorous game - but could also be used in a more serious way. It's a world where people are flawed, from the gods on down, and the darker side of human (etc) nature tends to shine through. So players can either join in with that or try to shine out as examples of virtue. Whether to play it lid-off (high-energy) or lid-on (gritty) is up to the GM.

user comment:
The Nugget rules are available as a free download from the publisher's site.

96755.name: The Prisoner
96755.description:
From the manual

Inspired by the highly acclaimed television series, your Apple puts you in a nightmare 1984 world whose rulers seek to break you down by an extensive array of brainwashing techniques, while you are armed only with your intelligence and sense of individuality. can you escape to freedom or will you remain forever THE PRISONER?

The resignation code is the very heart of the game, being the one reason that you have been imprisoned on the Island. The authorities are trying to get you to enter your resignation code into the computer. Under no circumstances are you to revel this number. Doing so will casue you to automatically lose the game.

You are represented by the "#". you move around the screen using the keyboard.

You will wind up in the Castle at the start of every session and the end of every unsuccessful escape attempt. Your arrival in the Castle represents a new day or adventure on the island. The Castle is really a maze, a prison within a prison from which to escape.

The island is composed of 20 different structures, each conatianing a different adventure or experience. Only four are pictured on the screen (From top down) at any one time. You may also occasionally see a gate to the outside world.

The only way to win the game is to escape from the Island. And the way to escape is to...

96756.name: Chivalry
96756.description:
From the manual

Welcome to Chivalry, an exciting new concept in computer board games for 1 to 4 players.

The King is held captive at The Castle of the Black Knight, on the lower right side of the game board. The players assemble at The Fair Castle, on the upper left side of the game board.

The nobles travel the path as directed by the computer (Basically Roll-And-Move 1 to 3 spaces.), bravely attempting the tasks given, playing games, following advice, and making decisions.

There are more than 20 seperate games contained within Chivalry. Some, like the shell game at The Witches' Brew Inn, need no explanation. All games can be played by following the general instructions (in the manual).

The first noble to reach the Black Knight and defeat him will rescue the King and be named the winner.

96757.name: Crazy Chicken
96757.description: Use your flippers to keep the eggs from getting into your 'basket'. The winner is the one who has kept the most eggs from getting in.

96758.name: Quble
96758.description:
Quble – A Twisting, Turning, Fun Word Game!

It's a cross between Boggle and a Rubik's Cube.

To play Quble, players have the option to twist and turn the cube to build words in 60-second rounds using letters worth varying point values (point values are indicated on each letter). The strategy is to search for the most or longest words and accumulate the highest score possible. Each player must decide how to best allocate their play time between moving the cube or searching and calling out each word with its point value. Typically, a game consists of 2 to 5 rounds of play. Players compete for the highest score by adding up the letter values for all words appearing anywhere around the cube. The letters can wrap around the sides of the cube from one face to another and must links diagonally, vertically, or horizontally. In QUBLE JUMBLE and FIRST TO FORTY, scoring may be based upon the length of the word. The more letters in a word, the more points.

Besides word game play, QUBLE can also be played as a conventional brain teaser by matching up each face of the puzzle by solid colors.

Rulebook includes 7 variants, mostly in the scoring and win conditions.

96759.name: Postal 2: Apocalypse Weekend
96759.description:
Apocalypse Weekend expands the reaches of Paradise with new maps and missions, set on Saturday and Sunday, adds new weapons and foes, and raises Postal 2's gore and violence to an even greater level. All normal cats are also replaced with "dervish cats", which spin in a manner similar to that of Looney Tunes Tasmanian Devil, attacking any nearby character when agitated. Dervish cats can also be collected and, in addition to muffling guns, can be thrown at NPCs to attack them. While gameplay is similar to its parent Postal 2, Apocalypse Weekend is not as open-ended. The gameplay is more linear in design, with the player mostly forced to follow a certain path to complete the game—typical of most first-person shooter games. In addition, the player cannot play as a pacifist and is forced to kill animals and zombies in order to progress in the game.

It can be downloaded or bought as part of Postal 2: Fudge Pack

Source: Wikipedia, "Postal 2", available under the CC-BY-SA License.

96760.name: Scrabble Pocket Puzzle
96760.description: Two 4 x 7 sliding-tile games, with a letter and point value on each tile. The goal is to achieve a high score by forming interlocking words both horizontally and vertically. Two boards allows for both solo and competitive play.

96761.name: In Repose: A Bed-time Story Game
rpgseries: Two Names One Game RPG Contest
96761.description:
Introduction:

Every night, before bed-time, my 8 year-old daughter and I have story time. When she was younger I read stories to her. After she began school she read to me. Lately we have been really enjoying creating stories together.

After trying out a few different ways of playing story-creating games together, we came up with the following simple rules, which seem to work fairly well, for us.

Game Info:
Number of Players: 2-4
Recommended Ages: 6 and up
Average Game Length: 8 minutes

user comment:
This game is available as a free download from 1km1kt

96762.name: Primal Carnage
96762.description:
Primal Carnage is an online asymmetrical class-based multiplayer computer game developed by independent game studio Lukewarm Media. The game pits a team of Dinosaurs versus a team of Mercenaries, allowing the players to choose to play as either side.

Source: Wikipedia, "Primal Carnage", available under the CC-BY-SA License.

96763.name: Troddlers
96763.description:
In Troddlers, you play as Hokus alone in solo mode. In multiplayer modes, player 2 plays as Pokus. The game is broken up into missions. Before each mission, a screen telling the mission objective and a few facts about the level (such as the number of Troddlers) is shown. A player must complete whatever task is given to him within the time limit (usually a few minutes). There are three main objectives that appear in the game: the more common objective involves leading stray Troddlers to an exit, somewhat similar to the gameplay in Lemmings. Another objective commonly given is the destruction of zombie Troddlers. The third involves collecting gems. Many levels combine two of these objectives and sometimes all three. There are, naturally, many obstacles and enemies throughout the game.

Source: Wikipedia, "Troddlers", available under the CC-BY-SA License.

96764.name: Croc 2
96764.description:
Croc2 is a video game released in 1999, is the sequel to Croc: Legend of the Gobbos, developed by Argonaut Software between 1998 and 1999, and published by Fox Interactive. Croc 2 was released on Game Boy Color, Windows, and PlayStation. A Dreamcast release was planned but eventually canceled. The plot revolves around Croc searching for missing parents, and saving the Inventor Gobbo from Baron Dante.

Source: Wikipedia, "Croc 2", available under the CC-BY-SA License.

boardgamehonor: 2013 Origins Award Best Collectible Card Game Nominee
96765.description:
ヴァンガード (Vanguard) is a Japanese trading card game published by Bushiroad. It was created in collaboration between Akira Itō (Yu-Gi-Oh! R), Satoshi Nakamura (Duel Masters), and Bushiroad president Takaaki Kidani. The game was also released in conjunction with a TV anime series, "カードファイト!! ヴァンガード" (Cardfight!! Vanguard).

In the game, players "ride" a unit as their Vanguard, which represents them on the board. They may also summon other units as Rear Guards to attack or support. The game is won by doing 6 points of damage to the opponent's Vanguard.

As players attack, if they are using their vanguard they can "drive check" whereby they check the top card of their deck for "triggers" which increase power and have other effects, and add these cards to their hand. Triggers can also be revealed when players take damage to their vanguard by performing a "damage check".

At the start of the game, each player places their grade 0 starting vanguard face down in the "vanguard circle" and then draws 5 cards. They may return any number of cards to the deck and re-draw to form their starting hand, but only once. It's a good tactic to return trigger cards from your first hand as these are better utilised when drawn from the deck as part of a "drive check" or "damage check".

Once the players are done setting up their initial hand they determine who goes first (often, rock-paper-scissors is used for this) and then each turn follows the same turn order:

1. Stand up (only at the start of the game, and both players perform this action simultaneously whereby they flip over their vanguard)
2. Stand and Draw
3. Ride
4. Call
5. Attack
6. Guard
7. Drive Check
8. Damage Check
9. (more attacks? Go back to 5)
10. Turn end - change to other player and go back to 2

It's worth noting that strategically, taking damage early in the game can be beneficial as you can use cards in the damage zone to "counter blast" (flip the cards over to activate special actions on certain units).
96765.name: CardFight!! Vanguard
boardgamepodcastepisode: Ep 22 CCGs & LCGs

96768.description:
Kings & Queens Rummy is a variant on contract rummy in which each round consists of two separate hands and players must play certain combinations of sets and runs with each hand while working toward the bigger goal of playing all of one's cards first.

To set up a round, the 216 cards – four decks, plus eight wild cards – are shuffled and each player dealt two separate piles of eleven cards. Players swap piles, then choose one of the two piles they hold to serve as their Queen hand. On a turn, a player draws the top card of the deck or the top three cards on the discard pile, optionally plays sets and runs and plays off opponents, then discards one card. To open, a player must first play a set and run from the Queen hand of 3-7 cards. Once the player does this, she may meld additional cards and play off opponents.

Once a player has run out of cards in the Queen hand, she picks up the other pile – the King hand – and needs to play a set of 3-7 cards from this hand before being able to play off opponents once again. The round ends when a player runs out of cards in her King hand. The other players are penalized based on the value of cards remaining in hand, and the player with the lowest score after five rounds wins.
96768.name: Kings & Queens Rummy

96769.name: Ask Pickles
96769.description:
A double-box with two games. Happy Families was one but the other was a quiz card game, associated with Wilfred Pickles (1900-1978). Pickles was a noted radio performer for 30 years, starting in the 40's. He is pictured on the box.
The game has 29 cards. Each card has questions on them, and a score that can be earned if you answer correctly; 5 points (yellow), 10 points (red) or 20 points (blue).

96771.name: Popeye Knock Out
96771.description: 36 cards featuring Popeye characters regularly seen in the TV version which started in 1961. Popeye is pictured on the box. The game play is simple. Each player gets a stack of cards. These remain face-down in front of him. The first player turns over the top card of his stack. If it is a character card, play passes to the next player. But if it is a Spinach card, the next player must 'Put' the nimber of cards indicated on the can of spinach (either 1, 2 or 3). If no more spinach is added whilst he is taking this action, all the cards played go to the player who played the spinach card and he puts them face-down under his stack.

96772.name: Huckleberry Hound 'Booby'
96772.description:
This is a slightly altered variant of Old Maid or Donkey. 36 cards featuring characters from The Huckleberry Hound Show, such as the Hound himself, Mr. Jinks, Yogi Bear and Pixie & Dixie.
Players must collect pairs of the same card. Curiously, the company have included two 'Booby' cards and added the instruction 'one is spare and should be removed before dealing'.

96773.name: A Trip to the Priory
96773.description:
User summary:
The first in a series of three solo adventures, A Trip to the Priory sets you on a quest to find an ancient heirloom, the Iron Cross. The abandoned Priory of St. Houst holds the first mysteries you must solve.

96774.name: Tilt Score
96774.description:
Object of the game is to manipulate Your marbles into the scoring wheel and be the first player whose scoring wheel makes one complete revolution.

Each player places his marbles into the outside channel of his teeter board. A player's scoring wheel is the same color as his teeter board.
At the word "GO" players work their teeter board in a teeter-totter motion manipulating their marbles up & down the teeter board and through the opening, attempting to manuever them into the scoring wheel. The first player whose scoring wheel makes one complete revolution wins the game.

96775.description:
"A relatively abstract game but still intensely exciting form of Motocross." - from the rules.
Players roll dice to create their rider by comparing each roll to the Preparation Chart. 5 rolls are needed per rider, giving him Basic Speed, Skill Rating, Block Ability, Control Rating and Stamina Factor. These five abilities are tested at different times during the race. It is a race game but has no board, laps are recorded on paper. The winner is the first rider to complete a set number of laps.
First published in Games Unlimited's Random fanzine.
96775.name: Mini-Motocross Game

96776.name: Ein, Zwei, Drei
96776.description:
A partnership card game, played with traditional playing cards.
Each player is dealt 13 cards but only 12 tricks are played for. The 13th card is used at the start to give to your partner. This should indicate how many tricks you think you can win. The card will be used later in the game. Tricks are won by playing 1, 2 or 3 cards. 1 card played is just a normal trick as in Bridge or Whist, but there are specific rules about what constitutes a trick playing 2 or 3 cards.
100 points equals a game. Before play begins, players decide on a 'best of' five, say, i.e. the first pair to score three games would be the winner.

boardgamehonor: 2001 Charles S. Roberts Best Modern Era Boardgame Nominee
2002 Charles S. Roberts Best Modern Era Boardgame Nominee
96777.description:
Back To Iraq, 3rd Edition (B2I3e) is a "what if" simulation of the fighting that might occur across the northern littoral of the Persian Gulf if the US-led anti-terrorism Coalition decides on a ground war to finally settle with the Baghdad regime.

B2I3e is a two player wargame of low to intermediate complexity that posits this might-be war lasting about a month. We believe that is about the maximum time before the Coalition Ground force's diminishing supplies, coupled with a loss of the domestic political will necessary to continue the fighting, would bring about a settlement if victory were not achieved in the field.

(Form the introduction).

Major changes with the previous editions are the units, with new Order of Battle and factors. The units also are now mostly "two steppers". The combat table is also different at all, with separate combat tables for coalition and Militant Islamic.

Two scenarios, one against Iraq and Al Qaeda, and the second also against Iran and Iraq. Turkish and Syrian intervention is possible in both scenarios.

The Advanced rules cover Strategic targets, Airstrikes, Special Operations Forces, Command and Control and Additional Forces

Game Scale:
Turn: 2 days
Hex: 17 miles / 27.54 km
Unit: Brigade to Army

Game Inventory:
One 22" X 34" mapsheet
One countersheet (176 5/8" counters)
One 24 page rules booklet
96777.name: Back to Iraq 3

96778.description: Cyclades: Hades, an expansion for Cathala and Maublanc's Cyclades, consists of four modules that can be used individually or combined in various ways. In the Cyclades base game, players fight for domination over archipelagos in ancient Greece. They make offerings to gods to secure their favors and summon mythological creatures. The Hades expansion allows players to add Hades (no surprise there) to other gods present in the base game: Zeus, Ares, Athena, Poseidon and Apollo. Players will be able to build a Necropolis and summon undead armies when they gain favors of Hades.
96778.name: Cyclades: Hades
boardgamepodcastepisode: Episode 9: Panamax, They Live, and Solforge
The Game Pit - Episode 29: The Expanded Expansion Special
The Good, The Board, and The Ugly Episode 4:  Most Overrated games (or Joe’s Most Overrated Games)

96781.name: Reaching for the top
96781.description:
In this game the players build a pyramid of glass marbles. Aim is to place the last marble on top of the pyramid.
Besides placing a new marble of his color on the board, a player can move one of his marbles already on the board by raising it one or two levels. Or a player can take back two marbles from the board by making a square using four of his own marbles.

This way a dynamic game is going on with a rising and shrinking pyramid.

96782.name: Il Gioco del Cinema
96782.description:
Italian game. The scope of the game is that one of guess the titles them of two films and to prepare a cinematographic troupe composed of 8 members.

The mechanism of the game is question and answer: if the answer is exact the player advances the number of spaces indicated on the cad, and will play out the event on the back of the card; if incorrect, the player moves back two spaces and is affected by the text on the space.

2340 questions in 12 categories.

96783.name: Rogue Ops
96783.description:
From the back of the case

Training gives her the skills, vengeance gives her the edge.

When the world's most brutal terrorist organization, Omega 19, killed Nikki Connors' husband and daughter, they didn't count on payback. Now, the ex-Green Beret has joined Phoenix, a covert agency dedicated to counter-terrorism. With unsurpassed skills, weapons expertise, and tools for concealment, she's ready to use stealth, stamina, and deadly force to take her revenge.

96784.name: Den mörka magin
96784.description:
Back of the book (in Swedish):

Den mörka magin - Biskop Ignations formelsamling är ett ovärderligt supplement till Gemini för dig som vill veta mer om den förföriska mörka magin och hur den fungerar och verkar i Geminis värld.

Boken innehåller bl. a.

över 100 nya besvärjelser
nya sätt att närma sig och använda aspekterna
regler för magi i strid
den fallne biskop Ignatius dagbok där fallet till mörkret skildras ur en kättares ögon




User translation:
The dark magic - Bishop Ignation's spellbook is an invaluable supplement for Gemini for those who want to know more about the alluring dark magic and how it work and act in the world of Gemini.

Including in the book are

over 100 new spells
new ways to get to know and use the aspects
rules for magic in combat
the fallen Bishop Ignation's diary where the fall into the dark is depicted from the view of a heretic

96786.name: SU-25 Stormovik
96786.description:
Back of Box

The first fighter simulation from the Soviet perspective.

Pilot the most battle-proven ground attack aircraft in the world.

Counteract the terrorist operation and protect the New Peace.

Join the aerial assault team of the Red Guard Strike Force.

Command your craft armed with 5 tons of ammunition.


Thirteen exterior views
Hundreds of missions
Realistic armored land vehicles and aircraft
Deluxe manual and detailed map

96787.name: Silly Socks
96787.description:
Collect pairs of socks, but don't pick up the underpants!

Each player gets three silly socks to start. On your turn take an item from the washing machine. If it's a sock that matches on of your three, put the pair in your laundry basket. But be careful. If you pull out a pair of pants you'll lose one turn until you can try for silly socks again. The first player to collect three matching pairs wins. For 2 to 4 players, ages 3 to 5.

96788.name: Elhendi
96788.description:
From the back of the rulebook:

»Elhendi« fantasiaroolipeli

Koe uskomattomia urotekoja, sankarillisia taisteluita ja uhrautuvaa ystävyyttä.
Tutki mystisiä paikkoja; muinaisia rakennuksia, tarumaisia temppeleitä ja alkuaikaisia metsiä.
Näe mahtavia maageja, voimakasta taikuutta ja hämmästyttäviä loitsuja.
Kohtaa verenhimoisia petoja, säälimättömiä hirviöitä ja häilyviä henkimaailman asukkeja.
Löydä ikivanhoja salaisuuksia, odottamattomia ansoja sekä muita kammottavia yllätyksiä.
Kerää hahmollesi kokemusta, kunniaa ja mainetta ja kehitä sen kykyjä ja taitoja aina yhdeksännelle tasolle asti!

Elhendin edeltäjä, legendaarinen haltiaroolipeli 'Rapier' loppuunmyytiin Suomessa ennennäkemättömän nopeasti. 'Rapierin' hyväksi koetun systeemin lisäksi Elhendi tarjoaa monia sekä täysin uusia että vanhoja hyviä, mutta selvennettyjä sääntökohtia. Pelin hahmonluonti on todella vapaata ja helppoa, taistelusäännöt ovat nopeat mutta silti monipuoliset. Elhendissä kuka tahansa pelihahmo voi perehtyä magian salaisuuksiin ja opetella loitsuja, joiden määrää on lisätty. Haltioiden yhteiskunnan ja mantereen historian taustatietojen lisäksi löytyy kirjasta mielenkiintoisia yksityiskohtia uskonnosta, jumalista, -taikaesineistä, yrteistä, elämistä, hirviöistä ja muista otuksista. Mukana seuraavat irrotettavat haltiamaan ja koko mantereen kartat ovat upeaa tekoa, kuten myös kirjan runsas kuvitus.

Uutuutena Elhendissä on mukana helppokäyttöinen seikkailugeneraattori, jolla kiireinen pelinjohtaja pystyy hetkessä luomaan mielikuvituksellisia seikkailujuonia tavoitteineen ja vihollisineen.

Elhendin parissa voit eläytyä ennenkokemattomiin fantastisiin seikkailuihin yhdessä ystäviesi kanssa. Elhendiin tarvitaan vähintään kaksi pelaajaa, suositeltava määrä on kolmesta kahdeksaan. Pelissä tarvitaan tämän sääntökirjan lisäksi kyniä, paperia ja joukko erikoisnoppia.

Elhendin pelaaminen edistää mielikuvituksen käyttöä ja luovaa ideointia, opettaa vapaata pelinjohtamista ja empaattista yhteistoimintaa. Lisäksi Elhendi fantasiaroolipeli tarjoaa tietysti pelaajilleen harmitonta, hauskaa ja jännittävää viihdettä tunneiksi - kuukauksiksi - vuosiksi.

---

Translation:

»Elhendi« fantasy roleplaying game
See the unbelievable heroism on battlefields and experience devoting friendship.
Explore mystical locations; ancient constructions, fabled temples and primeval woodland.
Meet mighty mages, strong spells and incredible incantations.
See bloodlust beasts, merciless monsters and wavering wanderers of spirit worlds.
Discover age-old secrets, unforeseen traps and other dreadful surprises.
Collect experience, prestige and honor to your character and build-up its skills and levels all the way up to the ninth level!
Elhend's predecessor legendary elven roleplaying game 'Rapier' was sold out in Finland unforeseen swift. Besides 'Rapier's' well balanced game system, Elhendi is offering many completely new but also clarified old good rules. Character creation is really simple and open-ended, fighting rules are quick but versatile. In Elhendi all characters can familiarize themselves with a secret of magic and learn cast spells. In addition to information about elven society and continents background stories core rulebook contains interesting details from religions, gods, -magical items, herbs, animals, monsters and another beings. With a book comes detachable map of elven lands and entire game continent. Maps are awesomely sketched as also plentiful illustrations of the book.
As a novelty in Elhendi is included easy to use adventure generator, which allows game masters with no extra time in hands to create just in a moment imaginary adventure schemes with unique aims and enemies.
Amidst Elhendi you can empathize never before experienced fantastic adventures together with your friends. For playing Elhendi you need at least two players, but it is recommended to have three to eight players. To play a game you need additionally to this core rulebook a pen, paper and set special of dice.
Playing Elhendi will develop the use of imagination and creative thinking; learn unfettered game mastering and empathic co-operation. In addition Elhendi fantasy roleplaying game offers to its player’s harmless, pleasant and exciting entertainment for hours - months - years.

96789.name: Blue Angels
96789.description:
Back of Box

Fly where only angels dare.

Beyond Top Gun academy resides an elite echelon of pilots that are truly the best and the brightest.

The Blue Angels.

An acrobatic squadron of U.S. naval aviators flying F/A-18s. Piercing the clouds on a wing and a prayer. Performing precision maneuvers that defy the laws of physics to dance with danger.

Now you've made the team.

Blue Angels Formation Flight Simulation takes you from ground school to the wild blue yonder. You'll perform the actual air show maneuvers that have made the Blue Angels legends of the sky.

Strap-in. Lower the canopy. Everything you've ever experienced in a flight simulation is about to take a 360-degree diamond roll.

96790.name: Blue Max (DOS)
videogameversion: North American DOS Dual Media edition
96790.description:
Back of Box

1914--the peaceful blue skies over France are shattered forever by the machine guns of mankind's first fighting aircraft.

The medal "Pour le Mérite"--The British called it "the Blue Max"--was awarded to the best German pilots of World War I. To flyers of both sides it symbolized the utmost in daring, courage and honor during a time that will never be repeated in the story of aviation.

In Blue Max: Aces of the Great War, begin by choosing sides and one of eight great fighters. Action is immediate and relentless, as you fly the most famous aircraft of the time--Fokker, Spad, Nieuport, Sopwith, Albatross--with the best of the best, including Richthofen, Fonck, Mannock, and Rickenbacker. Learn the characteristics of each plane, and the different tricks and techniques of each ace.

Different playing modes let one or two players fly solo, as a team, or against each other using the same computer. Fly in full action dogfights, undertake missions to destroy bridges and observation balloons, or work out strategies a segment at a time in detail.

96791.name: Vampyre: Dark Genesis
96791.description:
from the back of the book

Disaffected, jealous, prideful, Lucifer was cast from Heaven and from there, the world was cursed with the affliction of his son Satan, and in turn his children of the seven Vampire Houses.

Gothic Society creates an expansive and vibrantly sinister environment, where the world and history as we know it has always been influenced, manipulated and dominated, both overtly and covertly by Vampire powers.

The main rule book includes meticulous historical detail of the First Born Vampires, their subsequent offspring and their supernatural attributes, character creation rules, combat, character examples and enough exemplary information to bring this frightening world to life for role-playing enthusiasts.

Readers will be drawn into a dramatic and fluid setting, where fiction has been intricately woven into historical fact, and where characters must utilize strength and strategy to survive the ravages of a truly Twisted world.

96792.description:
Game description from the publisher:

Greed, Pride, Gluttony, Wrath, Luxury, Idleness, and Envy – the infamous "Seven Deadly Sins". For the faithful, they instill horror. For you, on the other hand, they present a wonderful business opportunity!

In The Road to Canterbury, you play a medieval pardoner who sells certificates delivering sinners from the eternal penalties brought on by these Seven Deadly Sins. You make your money by peddling these counterfeit pardons to Pilgrims traveling the road to Canterbury. Perhaps you can persuade the Knight that his pride must be forgiven? Surely the Friar's greed will net you a few coins? The Miller's wrath and the Monk's gluttony are on full public display and demand pardoning! The Wife of Bath regales herself in luxury, the Man-of-Law languishes in idleness, and that Prioress has envy written all over her broad forehead. And the naughty stories these Pilgrims tell each other are so full of iniquity they would make a barkeep blush! Pardoning such wickedness should be easy money, right?

Not quite. For you to succeed as a pardoner, you'll need to do more than just sell forged pardons for quick cash. To keep your services in demand, you will actually need to lead these Pilgrims into temptation yourself! Perhaps some phony relics might help? There is also one big catch. The Seven Deadly Sins live up to their name: each sin that a Pilgrim commits brings Death one step nearer, and a dead Pilgrim pays no pardoners!

So much to forgive, so little time. Will you be able to outwit your opponents by pardoning more of these Pilgrims' sins before they die or finish their pilgrimage to Canterbury?
96792.name: The Road to Canterbury
boardgamepodcastepisode: The One About Alf
The One About the 7 Deadly Sins
The One About the Perfect Library
The Spiel #210 - Sondry Folk

96793.name: Call of Duty
96793.description:
From the publisher's introduction:

"Call of Duty" is a Call of Cthulhu scenario set in the fictional city of Durban, Rhode Island, in the year 1925. The investigators play agents from the Federal Bureau of Investigation trying to shut down Antonio Marchesi's illegal operations, which include nefarious acts such as bootlegging and the release of Gods from beyond space and time. So! Pull down your fedora, check your badge, load another drum in your Tommy Gun, and get ready to put your sanity to the test―your superiors will never believe this.

96794.name: Gamemonster Guide
rpgsetting: The World of Tales from the Crypt
96794.description:
User summary:

Half of the book is filled with character write-ups and the other half with settings and adventure hooks.

96795.name: Pinpoint the Bomber
96795.description:
This is a book game. Published as a book it includes multiple black & white and color maps. There are 3 games described, the Red, the Green and the Black game.

The Black game is a solo effort to see how long it takes and how accurate you can be with determining your map pinpoints.

The Red game is meant for 4 players or fewer. It is a game of chance and is won by the first person to reach the bombing target (the German city of Coblenz).

The Green game is for any number of players, again as a game of chance but requires finding Pinpoints via Latitude and Longitude.

In the Red and Green games a number of aircraft set off from their base in Kent to bomb a target at Coblenz.

The games requires the player to copy and create miniature airplanes, Compass Rose, 10 deg angle indicator and Latitude/Longitude Finder.

The game includes maps as well as extensive briefing triggered by either a draw from a deck of cards or dice roll. The players continue to roll/draw cards until they land on the target by exact count. Any overshooting requires the bomber to fly back around.

A briefing can have extensive instructions causing the player to head off track or be attacked by enemy fighters ending in a change of course and position on the map.

96797.name: Sky Castles
96797.description:
Sky Castles is a tile and worker placement game where the players collect gemstones from castles in the clouds. The theme is aimed at children, but the game claims to provide scope for strategic play at all levels.

The tiles depict a cloudscape dotted with gemstones. Each turn the player selects one of four face-up tiles and places it into the cloudscape so that the borders match adjacent tiles, and can optionally place a sprite token to claim a cloud or section of sky. There are three scoring rounds where the players score points for the gemstones that their sprites have claimed.

The gameplay is similar to other tile placement games (e.g. Carcassonne) but Sky Castles has less complexity and claims to be suitable for a younger audience while retaining similar strategic options.

96798.name: Chuck Yeager's Advanced Flight Trainer
96798.description:
Chuck Yeager's Advanced Flight Trainer is a 1987 computer aircraft simulation game produced by Electronic Arts. Chuck Yeager served as technical consultant for the game, where his likeness and voice were prominently used.

The game allows a player to "test pilot" 14 different airplanes, including the Bell X-1, which Yeager had piloted to become the first man to exceed Mach 1. Other aircraft one can test fly include the SR-71 Blackbird; the P-51 Mustang; the Cessna 172 Skyhawk; the F-16 and the F/A-18.

The game is embellished by Yeager's laconic commentary: When the user crashes one plane, Yeager remarks "You really bought the farm on that one!"

Game reviewers Hartley and Patricia Lesser complimented the game in their "The Role of Computers" column in Dragon #126 (1987), stating "There is so much in this game that it’s going to be quite some time before another flight simulator can offer so much performance for your buck." The reviewers gave the PC/MS-DOS version of the game 4 out of 5 stars.

The game was followed in 1989 by Chuck Yeager's Advanced Flight Trainer 2.0 and in 1991 by Chuck Yeager's Air Combat.

Source: Wikipedia, "Chuck Yeager's Advanced Flight Trainer", available under the CC-BY-SA License.

96799.name: Chuck Yeager's Advanced Flight Trainer 2.0
96799.description:
Back of Box

Push The Edge of the Envelope


18 aircraft with accurate aerodynamics and realistic 3-D modelled graphics. Spads, P-51's, F-18's, X-19's, the Space Shuttle. . .the FY-117A real stealth fighter.



Unlimited camera angles plus zooms, pans, shadows and under-the-belly fly-bys add drama to your maneuvers.



Six race courses including the famous Reno Unlimited. Compete against your own best flights or challenge your friends.



Master daredevil aerobatics like Immelmans, Hammerhead Stalls and Four Point Roll.



Join the Blue Angels or Thunderbirds. Perform Diamond 360's and Line Abreast Loops.



All new realistic terrain lets you buzz the tower, or risk hair-raising canyon runs.



Night flying adds to the thrill with real constellations.

96800.name: La guerra de los signos
96800.description:
In this game, two spacecraft armies fight each other as they try to reach the earth first and conquer it.

Each army is composed by 6 combat modules, each one representing one of the signs of the zodiac, and a mothership. The motherships are able to shoot "disc missiles" but only only can move laterally along the gameboard's central circle, while the combat modules can move forward and feature an spring-based system that makes them "explode" in case one disc missile hits it's front.

At the start of the game, each combat module is placed over it's correspondent sign in the circle, and the motherships are placed in each side of the gameboard. The starting player moves one of his modules one square forward and then shoots his mothership. If he hits and destroys one of the other player's modules, he can advance one of his again, until he fails, ending his turn. The first to move one of his modules over the central square (The earth) wins the game.

96801.name: Other Hands (Issue 28 - Oct 1999)
rpgissuearticle: A Grammar and Dictionary of Silvan Elvish
A Grammar and Dictionary of Silvan Elvish Con't
Halls of the Elven-King - Cover Page
Siriann's Song for Genelas and Muristil

96802.name: Other Hands (Issue 27 - Oct 1999)
rpgissuearticle: The Enchanters of Mirkwood - Cover Page

96803.name: Other Hands (Issue 29/30 - Jan 2000)
rpgissuearticle: An Alternative Continental Map for MERP
An Alternative Continental Map for MERP - Map
An Alternative Continental Map for MERP - Map 2
The Mirror of Fire - Cover Page

96804.name: Other Hands (Issue 31/32 - Jan 2000)
rpgissuearticle: Editorial: A Journey to the Crossroads
Mayhem Under the Mountain - Cover Page
The Shadowy Isles of the Great Sea
Tol Fuin and the Shadowy Isles
Using D&D 3rd Edition for Using Middle-earth Campaigns

96805.name: Fussball Manager 2002
96805.description:
User Summary

The Fussball Manager series is the most detailed simulation of the career of a football manager. The player choses a club which he wants to lead to success and manages the team year for year.

If he does a bad job (or a very good) he may switch to another club and continue his job there. He also has to manage his private life, a feature that future games of the series doesn't have anymore.

Games may be watched in 3D and even a bit of interaction is possible. The manager may act as trainer and yell commands but if they have any effect is unknown.

Parts of the manager's tasks can be automated so that the AI takes over, reducing the game to those parts that are interesting to the player.

The game is licensed by the DFB and features real clubs and names.

96806.name: Władca zimy
96806.description:
Publisher's blurb:

Nad wschodnią prowincją Imperium zbierają się zimowe chmury. W sekrecie ostlandzką ziemię przemierza tajemniczy gobliński szaman, odprawiając dziwne rytuały. Gobliny Zimy zejdą z Gór Środkowych. Ich szlak będzie znaczyć krew i lodowe ofiarne kręgi.

Na straży siół i miasteczek stoi ostlandzka armia. Czy grupie zwykłych, szarych żołnierzy uda się rozwikłać tajemnicę grożącego Ostlandowi niebezpieczeństwa? Czy w porę dostrzegą lepkie nici pajęczyny oplatającej prowincję? Czy przetrwają konfrontację z tajemniczym i nieobliczalnym Władcą Zimy?

Wojskowy klimat, dyscyplina, odpowiedzialność, honor i braterstwo. Moralne dylematy Starego Świata. Trudne wybory między obowiązkiem a prawością. Poświęcenie, krew i ból. Bohaterstwo, zdrada i zemsta. Żelazo i stal, magia i wiara.

• Cztery przygody najlepszych polskich twórców scenariuszy do Warhammera
• Nowe postacie, czary, opcjonalne zasady
• Artykuły o nowatorskich sposobach prowadzenia
• Dokładna mapa i opis Ostlandu
• Pierwsza w historii napisana przez Polaków i dla Polaków kampania do Warhammera

:




And the English translation:

Clouds gather over the eastern province of the Empire. A mysterious goblin shaman travels in secret trough the lands of Ostland, performing strange rituals. The winter goblins will descend from the Middle Mountains. Their path will be marked by blood and sacrificial circles made of ice.

The Ostland army is tasked with protection of the small towns and villages. Can a group of ordinary, common soldiers manage to unravel the mystery of the imminent danger? Can they pierce through the shrouds of mystery surrounding them? Can they survive a confrontation with a mysterious and unpredictable Winter Master? (Władca Zimy)?

Experience the military atmosphere, discipline, responsibility, honor and brotherhood. The moral dilemmas of the Old World. The tough choices between the duty and righteousness. Sacrifice, blood and pain. Heroism, betrayal and revenge. Iron and steel, magic and faith.

• Four adventures created by the best polish Warhammer RPG writers.
• New character professions, spells and optional rules
• Articles describing new ways of Game Mastering
• Detailed map and description of Ostland
• First ever Warhammer campaign written by Poles for Poles (user comment: this last point is not a sign of xenophobia, but rather a cultural reference)

96807.name: Fallout: Brotherhood of Steel
96807.description:
From the back cover:

Welcome to the wasteland

...where humanity struggles to pick up the pieces after a devistating nuclear war. As a courageous member of the Brotherhood of Steel, your mission is to bring peace to this post-apocalyptic warld filled with relentless chaos and radioactive nightmares.

96808.name: Crime Crackers
96808.description:
User Summary

Kind of like Eye of the Beholder--in space.

96809.name: Escaform
96809.description:
User Summary

A rather difficult game to get into because of the control system, but with amazing PS graphics and an epic storyline. It reminds me of the Persona series graphically, and due to its experimental nature.

96810.name: Guitar Hero: On Tour: Modern Hits
96810.description:
Guitar Hero On Tour: Modern Hits was announced on March 5, 2009. Reflecting its title, Modern Hits incorporates songs published within the last five years of its release, and the developers had to balance what songs were included in order to make a setlist with a wide appeal. The engine of the game has no major changes, but Vicarious Visions stated that it has continued to work on strum detection on the DS touchpad to meet a wide range of playstyles. The interface, however, has been revised over the previous two On Tour titles to feature a more modernized look (particularly in-game on the touch screen side). The game includes a new single player career progression using "Fan Requests" to create a new non-linear progression through the songs in the games. These were added to help move away from gameplay that was "just going, playing a venue, and then moving on to the next one" and instead to "open the world up". The developers also noted that the Fan Requests helped to tap into the way that players had previously played games in the series, setting their own personal goals for certain songs

Source: Wikipedia, "Guitar Hero: On Tour series", available under the CC-BY-SA License.

96811.name: Tic Tac Throw
96811.description:
Aim! Throw! Claim a square! Or knock your opponent out of there!

The classic 2-player skill game Tic Tac Toe just got more action-packed with Tic Tac Throw! Players must throw the cubes with "x" and "o" on the vinyl board in right places to form the row.
Try to be the first to get Tic Tac Toe!

96812.name: Other Hands (Issue 33/34 - Jul 2001)
rpgissuearticle: Editorial: What is it Good For?
The House of Warcraft - Cover Page
Why Did the Three Rings Lose Their Powers?

96814.name: Knights of the Dinner Table Magazine (Issue 167 - Sept 2010)
rpgissuearticle: Back Room at the Games Pit
Beyond the Book: New Rules & Variants for HackMaster Basic
Confessions of a Four Legged Game
The Good, the Bad and the Ugly
The Orc is Not my Son
96814.description:
Knights of the Dinner Table Magazine
Issue #167
September 2010

Me Tarzan You Slain

Cover art by Jeff Langcaon

96815.description:
From the back:
CAPTAIN'S LOG #1 features the short story and scenario, "Objective: Juggernaut," by Christopher Allen. This story creates a unique background for a five player situation which requires skill in combat and finesse in diplomacy. Involved are the Federation, Tholian, Klingon, Orion and the fearsome extra-galactic Juggernaut.
Also included in CAPTAIN'S LOG #1 are the diagrams and rules needed to resolve combat in the same hex. This system will make combat in the same hex more realistic and systematic.
NOTE! This product adds new play situations and rules for the STAR FLEET UNIVERSE. YOU MUST HAVE the boxed edition of STAR FLEET BATTLES to play any of the scenarios presented. Additionally, many of the scenarios draw on material published in the three STAR FLEET BATTLES EXPANSIONS. These products are recommended for maximum enjoyment of the material presented.
96815.name: Captain's Log #1

96816.name: Starmada: Fleet Ops
96816.description:
Starmada: Fleet Ops is a "fleet-scale" game using the same database as Starmada: Admiralty Edition science-fiction starship combat game. S:FO is very similar to S:AE in many respects, but Starmada: Fleet Ops' flow is intended to be faster-moving and more abstracted.

Game scale is "grand tactical", each ship is a single counter on the map, and its statistics (damage level, weapons, and so on) are tracked individually, although not in as much detail as Starmada: Admiralty Edition. (Any ship you can build using Admiralty Edition's ship design rules can be represented in Starmada: Fleet Ops, making the two games highly compatible).Construction rules are included, and also guidelines on converting Admiralty Edition ships to Fleet Ops statistics. An entire fleet of ships can be represented on a single standard sheet of paper.

Play is simultaneous. Each player takes turns giving orders to his units by placing a marker on top of one ship to indicate the orders it has been given. Once all ships have orders, initiative is determined. The player losing initiative moves all his ships first (giving the non-moving player an advantage), but then fires first in the subsequent fire phase (gaining an advantage).

Movement and firing are both simplified and sped up from Admiralty Edition, reducing the amount of record keeping and the number of die rolls. Mechanics new to the Starmada system are introduced, including morale and command ships.

The product is available as either a download in Adobe .pdf format, or as a print-on-demand saddle-stitched book (44 pages). Additional material, including printable colour counters and map sheets, is available for free download from Majestic 12 Games' website for purchasers of either format.

96817.name: Knights of the Dinner Table Magazine (Issue 166 - Aug 2010)
rpgissuearticle: Back Room at the Games Pit
Beyond the Book: New Rules & Variants for HackMaster Basic
Gamemasters' Workshop: The Good The Bad and the Ugly
How to Kick Start a Campaign
Lookin' at Comics: Philly and San Antonio Comic Cons
The Boy is Back in Town
The Orc is Not My Son Part II
Web Scryer: Get Rolling with 2010 Award Winners
96817.description:
Knights of the Dinner Table Magazine
Issue #166
August 2010

15 Minutes of Shame

Cover art by George Vrbanic and Jackie Vrbanic.

96818.name: Hexxagon
96818.description:
User Summary

Hexaggon is an abstract strategy game where the goal is to occupy the majority of the board.
As the name of the game indicates, the board is made of hexagons.
Two kinds of moves are allowed:
- Clone: clone your piece next to one of your existing pieces.
- Jump: move your piece one hex away from your starting position.

If you move/clone next to your opponent, you'll transform each one of his/her pieces into one of your own.

96819.name: Hexxagon 2
96819.description:
User Summary

Like in Hexxagon, Hexxagon 2 is an abstract strategy game where the goal is to occupy the majority of the board.
As the name of the game indicates, the board is made of hexagons.
Two kinds of moves are allowed:
- Clone: clone your piece next to one of your existing pieces.
- Jump: move your piece one hex away from your starting position.

If you move/clone next to your opponent, you'll transform each one of his/her pieces into one of your own.

Hexxagon 2 adds new features, improved graphics and animations.

96820.name: Putty
96820.description:
Putty Moon, the place where all the putties live, has been taken over by an evil wizard named Dazzledaze. Putty has been banished from the moon to the planet below. To return to Putty Moon and oust the evil wizard, Putty enlists the help of some robots ("bots") to build a skyscraper that will reach up to Putty Moon.

In Putty, the player controls a blue blob with eyes. Putty has many moves that he could use to attack enemies or to navigate around the level. These abilities include being able to stretch out upwards, downwards, left and right to access far-off ledges. He also has the ability to inflate. This allows him to provide a cushioned landing for any falling bots. Over-inflation also acts as a "smart bomb", with Putty bursting, killing all of the enemies on the screen, whilst reducing his health in the process.
Putty is able to form part of himself into a fist, allowing him to punch left or right to dispatch enemies.
Putty is also able to melt into the floor, making him invulnerable and also allowing him to absorb enemies, recovering a small amount of health in the process. With certain enemies in the game, such as the clockwork orange, once Putty has absorbed one he is then able to morph into the enemy's shape to use its abilities.
A final ability of Putty's is being able to create a mug of coffee from part of himself, which will distract bots and make them stand still.

Source: Wikipedia, "Putty (computer game)", available under the CC-BY-SA License.

96821.name: Verne Character Creator
96821.description:
From the Introduction:

This is a semi-automated adventurer creator for Verne. The way it works is pretty simple:

Go to the next page
Initialize things by hitting the red reset button
Answer the questions from your adventurer's point of view, or hit the "random" button to generate a semi-random selection of answers
When you are happy with the answers, hit the "calculate" button. This will generate both a nationality and a profession for the adventurer
Go to the adventurer sheet on the last page and hit the "make adventurer" button. This will generate a full selection of Attributes, skills and Traits for the adventurer.




There a number of ways you can do this for generating adventurers, and some hidden tips and tricks. We recommend that if you are going to generate adventurers using the questions, that you get three tries at it. If you do not like the results of your first questions, you can change up to three answers and try again, and then one more time if you still do not like it. As long as you keep track of the changes, this gives you three adventurers to choose from.

Now for some detailed stuff. This adventurer creator works off of Victorian stereotypes. Each answer has weighting factors that will lean it towards a nationality and a profession. The total result of your answers is in the bar graphs on the lower left of the page. And because it is based on stereotypes, you can "game the system" fairly easily. For instance, if you choose a sexist Catholic who values his reputation above all else, thinks his nation is strong (but is not sure of it) and prefers style over substance, you're well on your way to a Spaniard (an Italian would value love over all else). Or, if you choose a Protestant who knows his nation is a major player, is slightly racist, prefers order to chaos and believes troubles are to be endured, then congratulations, you're probably going to be an Englishman.

The wealth of an adventurer is based on the Verne rules and EABA guidelines. This means there can be extraordinary variation in wealth. Some professions pay more than others, the Wealth Trait magnifies this, and skill levels also adjust things. You can have a starting adventurer who is destitute, or one who has a country manor and owns their own ocean-going steamship.

96822.name: Gondica
96822.description:
Back of the book (in Swedish):

Gondica är ett action-inriktat fantasy-rollspel. Spelet är komplett och den enda ytterligare utrustning deltagarna behöver för att spela är papper, penna och minst fyra sexsidiga tärningar, samt massor av fantasi.

Gondica innehåller vad som behövs, till exempel:

Din rollperson tillhör en av fem intelligenta arter.
Du kan välja bland mer än 20 förslag till rollpersonens bakgrund och massor av färdigheter.
Fem olika typer av magi beskrivs.
Det civiliserade Vidonia och det barbariska Digerveden beskrivs noggrant, tillsammans med en översiktlig introduktion till kontinenten Pangaia,
Detaljerade beskrivningar av hamnstaden Atreburg och skogsbosättningen Nygard.
Introduktionsäventyret Skuggor ur det förflutna hjälper dig att snabbt komma igång med en kampanj.
Det finns massor av små uppslag till andra äventyr i Vidonia: spionage, sjöröveri, upptäcktsfärder, handel, dolska politiska intriger och mycket annat.




User translation:

Gondica is an action-oriented fantasy role-playing game. The game is complete and the only extra material the participants need are paper, pen and at least four six-sided dice, in addition to a lot of imagination.

Included in Gondica is everything you need, for example:

Your character belongs to one of five intelligent species.
You can choose from more than 20 background suggestions and plenty of skills.
Five different types of magic are described.
Detailed descriptions of the civilized Vidonia and the barbaric Digerveden, together with an introduction of the continent Pangaia.
Detailed descriptions of the port Atreburg and the woodland settlement Nygard.
The introductory adventure Shadows from the past helps you get into a campaign with ease.
There are lots of adventure hooks in Vidonia: espionage, piracy, exploration expeditions, trade, hidden political intrigues and lots more.

96823.name: Dragon Shadow Spell
96823.description:
User Summary

Like a lavish Final Fantasy Tactics, but with anime cut scenes.

96824.name: Seaman II
96824.description:
"Seaman (シーマン Shīman) is a virtual pet video game for the Sega Dreamcast. It is one of the few Dreamcast games to take advantage of the microphone attachment, which in Seaman uses a (relatively) sophisticated form of voice recognition technology. The substantial narration is voiced by Leonard Nimoy in the English-language version.

A limited edition version of the game titled Christmas Seaman was released in Japan on December 16, 1999 alongside a translucent, red Dreamcast. In 2001, Seaman was re-released in Japan for the PlayStation 2 as Seaman: Kindan no Pet - Gaze Hakushi no Jikken Shima (シーマン~禁断のペット~ガゼー博士の実験島), the first edition of which came with a microphone."

Source: Wikipedia, "Seaman_(video_game)," available under the CC-BY-SA License.

8, Upcoming White Wolf Releases

96832.name: War Eagles
96832.description:
Back of Box

An early morning mist covered much of the battlefield as a pale, springtime sun rose in the eastern sky. A single Allied RE8 two-seater reconnaissance aircraft slowly circled the German positions below. Bursting from the clouds, the sun at its back, machine guns blazing, a bright red Fokker DR I Triplane took aim at point-blank range on the lumbering reconnaissance plane.

Now it's your turn!

Now, from the cockpit of your own fighter, you can test yourself against the greatest air aces of World War I. Challenge the "Red Baron" von Richtohfen (sic) or go up against the "White Knight" Billy Bishop in a test of skill and daring, where the losers crash and burn!

Choose your own type of aircraft, from the sassy Sopwith Camel to the ominous Fokker Triplane. Learn the tactics and maneuvers that can spell the difference between glory and death!

No heat seeking missiles or distant targets here. This type of combat is "up close and personal." It's you versus "him", and he's very, very, good!

Features:


3-D Digitized Animation - No "dancing" polygon shaped objects in War Eagles. Each aerial object has been "digitized" from 37 different angles to provide added realism and authenticity.



10 Missions - Ten separate, distinct and constantly changing hazardous missions with varying speeds and skill levels from which to choose.



Multiple Views - View forward, back or to either side, as well as follow your own action from a chase plane at close, medium or far range.



Scoring - Pilot rosters are maintained and updated with top "aces" listed, as well as medals and decorations awarded.



Realistic action - Individual aircraft performance authenticity reproduces actual flying conditions, and realistic wartime circumstances are maintained.

96834.name: Pirate Ship Higemaru
96834.description:
Pirate Ship Higemaru​ is an action/puzzle game by Capcom originally released in 1984 as a coin-operated arcade game. The game was later included in the 1998 compilation Capcom Generations: The First Generation for the PlayStation (in Japan and Europe) and Sega Saturn (Japan only). Like the other games in the Capcom Generations titles, it was included in the 2005 compilation Capcom Classics Collection for the PlayStation 2 and Xbox, and in the PlayStation Portable version Capcom Classics Collection: Reloaded, which was the first time the game was released for home consoles in North America.

Source: Wikipedia, "Pirate Ship Higemaru", available under the CC-BY-SA License.

96835.name: Vulgus
96835.description:
Vulgus (バルガス) is a vertically scrolling shooter developed and published by Capcom in Japan in 1984, and was later released in North America by SNK the same year. The word "Vulgus" comes fom Latin and means "common people", people of lower layers of society. The game has the distinction of being Capcom's debut video or arcade game. The game is also included in Capcom Classics Collection and is now available as freeware.

Source: Wikipedia, "Vulgus", available under the CC-BY-SA License.

96836.name: Bestiarium
96836.description:
Publisher blurb:

Bestiariet är på 48 A4-sidor och innehåller ca 50 djur och odjur från olika delar av Pangaia. Dessutom finns det med regler för hur man utkämpar sjöslag mellan skepp och sjöodjur och anvisningar hur aristosofiska styggelser bör hanteras av spelledaren.

User translation:

The Bestiary is 48 A4-pages and contains around 50 animals and beasts from different parts of Pangaia. In addition to this there are rules for sea battles between ships and sea beasts, and instructions on how aristosofic abominations should be handled by the game master.

96837.name: Socker
96837.description:
Socker is a two player breakthrough abstract board game that simulates a soccer or rugby-like game where socking opposing pieces is a means to the end zone.

Socker is played on a 9x11 field, 9 columns and 11 rows. Each player has five man tokens (for example meeples), called sockers, and there is a ball token.

To set up the game, the ball is placed in the center space of the board. Players toss a coin to see who plays first. Starting with the toss winner, each player places all his or her sockers upright on any empty spaces that are in their nearest half of the field, but not adjacent (vertically, horizontally or diagonally) to the ball and not in the center row.

Players continue alternating turns and do the following.

On a turn, a player must perform one to three actions listed below using any of his or her upright (referred to as active) sockers.

Move. An active socker may be moved to any adjacent empty space. This includes the goal and out of bounds areas. However, at the end of a player’s turn, no more that three of his or her sockers may be in the goal and out of bounds regions.
Kick. If an active socker is adjacent to the ball, the ball may be kicked directly away one space provided the destination space is empty.

Sock. If an active socker is adjacent to an opponent’s socker, then the opponent’s socker may be pushed directly away one space provided the destination space is empty. The pushed socker is then put on its side to indicate that it is inactive and will not be able to perform any actions for one turn.

Any action or active socker may be used multiple times. Player may use any combination of actions and active sockers, and in any order they like.

When a player completes his or her actions all that player’s inactive sockers are put upright and become active again. This ends the player’s turn.

The goal of the game is to kick the ball over your goal line, into your farthest 1x9 row. Players can choose either of the following winning conditions: first to score a set number of goals (usually one), or most goals after a set number of turns followed by sudden death if necessary. After a goal, players should use the setup procedures with the non-scoring player going first. For sudden death, only two sockers per player are used, and a coin toss is used to determine who plays first.

Special Rules

Out of Bounds: The first and last columns of the playing field excluding the goal spaces are out of bounds. If the ball is pushed out of bounds, the ball is immediately moved to the center space of the same row. If the center space is occupied, the owner of the occupying socker can choose any empty space adjacent to the center space.

Repeat Positions: When a position is repeated, the player that plays next gets one extra action (total of four instead of three) to break the deadlock.

Static Positions: The maximum number of sockers on the edge is three. This prevents unmovable defensive positions behind the goal line or along the sides of the board. That is, positions where the offensive player can not push the ball or an opponent's socker.

96840.name: 3-D Helicopter Simulator
96840.description:
Back of Box

Learn to fly without wings.

Introducing the 3-D Helicopter Simulator, a red hot combination of computerized flight training with realistic action! Find yourself strapped in the pilot's seat of an authentic helicopter. Feel the rush as you zoom in from of or behind 3-Dimensional skyscrapers, towers and mountains. Get a bird's eye view from the cockpit as you soar above sailing ships in the harbor.

The 3-D Helicopter Simulator is an exciting step forward in bringing the "true" feel of flight into your home or office! Take hold of the cyclic joystick and feel the smoothness of the operating controls as you bank into a 30 degree turn. Test its flexibility by dodging incoming missiles.

Now experience head-to-head combat! Through optional modem support!

You've seen head-to-head sports simulations and head-to-head simulations. But never before has a computer program permitted head-to-head flight simulation competition...until now! Warm up against a computer-controlled opponent, then prepare to fly in tandem with a real-life partner or engage an opponent in air-to-air warfare. Your 3-D helicopter can duel another 3-D helicopter from across the room or across the world through the hook-up of a modem.

96848.description:
The Mage Knight board game puts you in control of one of four powerful Mage Knights as you explore (and conquer) a corner of the Mage Knight universe under the control of the Atlantean Empire. Build your army, fill your deck with powerful spells and actions, explore caves and dungeons, and eventually conquer powerful cities controlled by this once-great faction! In competitive scenarios, opposing players may be powerful allies, but only one will be able to claim the land as their own. In cooperative scenarios, the players win or lose as a group. Solo rules are also included.

Combining elements of RPGs, deckbuilding, and traditional board games the Mage Knight board game captures the rich history of the Mage Knight universe in a self-contained gaming experience..
