96852.name: Express Additions (Issue 10 - Oct 2008)
96852.description:
From Introduction:

Welcome to the 10th issue of Express Additions! We have several articles that we think you will find very interesting.

First up, we have an article on Training Packages. In addition to guidelines and rules for creating and using them, we also provide you with a collection of 50 common Training Packages that can be found in nearly any setting.

Next up we give you a new option regarding the casting time of spells, and then we introduce a new feature that we will be adding to all of our PDF lines, a review of a product from the The Vault.

And finally, we top off the issue with 4 more spells lists. These lists were designed for use with the Folio rules, and the professions from Express Additions #9.

96853.name: Express Additions (Issue 11 - Dec 2008)
96853.description:
From Introduction:

Welcome to the 11th issue of Express Additions! In this issue, we bring you a gift, or to put it more accurately, Gifts Galore; an article that provides you with the opportunity to add Gifts (often known as Talents) to your character.

We start off with some basic rules for including and using Gifts, and then we follow it up with a good selection of Gifts to start you off with.

We will finish off the issue with the first actual fan submission that we have received. An article titled An Alternative to Level Bonuses by Scott Heyden.

96854.name: Express Additions (Issue 12 - Jan 2009)
96854.description:
From Introduction:

Welcome to the 12th issue of Express Additions!

In this issue, we take a look at an altogether new way of handling Level Bonuses for characters. We also bring you an option on layering armors.

And we top off the issue with 3 new professions; the Archer, the Scout, and the Beastmaster.

96855.name: Robot
96855.description:
website blurb:
From the characterful and sophisticated droids of film to simple drones, this book will allow players to construct and play a variety of robots covering all Traveller universes. From the Third Imperium to Judge Dredd, robots rapidly become ubiquitous items on high technology worlds, and this book will allow you to construct, outfit and modify robots of any type with a simple to use yet comprehensive system.

96856.name: Tenis: Diana
96856.description: This is a very simple, turn-based, game, aimed mainly at kids. The objetive is to score the more points possible, using little rackets to throw some badminton-like plastic cones into a score field. The one who get the most points, wins.

96857.name: Tharos
96857.description:
From the back of the book:

Tharos er en udvidelse til bordrollespillet Ulvevinter, og bringer ekstremateriale til både reglerne og rollespillets univers.

I Tharos finders du:

Nye troldmandsformularer, herunder den frygtede sortekunst.
Nye sagnvæsner. Mød blandt andet mosekonen, havfolk og bjergtrolde.
Magiske genstande; drikke, våben, rustninger, smykker og meget mere.
Beskrivelser af næsten halvtreds af Tharos' vigtigste personligheder - og hvordan du kan bruge dem i dine eventyr.
Byen Ulfshalle - og fem hemmeligheder som byen gemmer på.
Tharos' krønike - en kort gennemgang af verdenens ofte blodige historie.




Ulvevinter er et rollespil der foregår i en fantasiverden, der er beboet af tapre vikinger, vise troldmænd og farlige uhyrer.

Læs mere om Ulvevinter, og hen masser af gratis materiale, på:

www.rollespilsforlaget.dk

Translated to:
Tharos is an expansion for the tabletop roleplaying game Wolveswinter, and includes new material for both the rules and the universe of the roleplaying gamer.

In Tharos you will find:

Nye magical spells, including the feared dark arts.
Nye creatures of legend. Meet among others the bog wife, sea people and mountain trolls.
Magical items; potions, weapons, armour, jewellery and much more.
Description of nearly fifty of the most importent people in Tharos - and how you can use them in your adventures.
The town Ulfshalle - and five secrets hiden in the town.
Tharos' chronicle - a short description of the worlds often bloody history.




Wolveswinter is a tabletop roleplaying game that takes place in a fantasy world, where brave vikings, wise wizards and dangerous monsters lives.

Read more about Wolveswinter, and get lots of free material, on:

www.rollespilsforlaget.dk

96859.name: The Operational Art of War II: Flashpoint Kosovo
videogameexpansion: The Operational Art of War II: Modern Battles 1956-2000
96859.description:
User Summary

This was an expansion to The Operational Art of War II: Modern Battles 1956-2000. Like most TalonSoft expansions it was released within a year of the original release of the game and contained some patches for the base game and a handful of new missions.

96861.name: Tzar: The Burden of the Crown
96861.description:
Tzar: The Burden of the Crown is a real-time strategy game for the PC published by Take-Two Interactive and developed by the Bulgarian game developer company Haemimont Games. It was released March 31, 2000. The game was not an extreme success; however, it got mild recognition and audience when it was published as a demo in several gaming magazines.

The gameplay is set up in a fictional medieval age. The basic goal is to conquer the neighbouring kingdoms and destroy all traces of them, or destroy their Castles, depending on selected playing mode. There are many different buildings and characters you can produce, each depending on which of the 3 races you choose to be: European, Asian or Arabian. The main differences are the types of special buildings available, and the types of troops you can make. There is also a campaign option for single players in which the player must complete specific goals, such as destroying an enemy force, or protecting a citadel from attack. The game also includes a map editor where players can create their own map to play on with strategic rivers, forests, and resources to build their armies with.

Source: Wikipedia, "Tzar: The Burden of the Crown", available under the CC-BY-SA License.

96862.name: Super Kart Party 3 Plus!
96862.description:
Designer Summary:

With the release date for SKP3+ looming ever closer, crunch time is upon you. The testers are working 12 hours a day, 7 days a week minimum to try to get this stupid game whipped into shape, and the programmers look like they haven‟t seen the sun in a while. Chances are it‟s just not going to make it, but don‟t let management hear you talking that way. (Not that they want to hear what you have to say at the best of times.) Just fucking get to work.

96863.name: The Knights of Light
96863.description:
Designer Summary:

The Knights of Light are a small, local guild for an extremely popular MMORPG that shall remain unnamed. You’re all pretty damn serious about this whole thing. You play very regularly, and if you make plans for a raid you are absurdly dedicated to keeping them. Your fellow guild members don’t always get along, but for the most part everyone knows what they’re doing in the game. (Too bad you can’t say the same about life in general.) Chances are you haven’t actually met in person, but that’s probably going to change, because Fiasco games are crazy like that.

96864.name: Shadow, Sword and Spell: Expert
96864.description:
from the introduction:
SHADOW SWORD & SPELL: EXPERT answers the question: What’s next? Your hero has grown in power, and now they are ready to tame the world. Building upon the rules found in BASIC, EXPERT adds new opportunities for your game. What you will find here are new options and rules that you can use to expand your current SHADOW, SWORD & SPELL game, as well as allow you to run games grander in scope.

96865.description:
A devilish print-and-play game of temporal competition, where two time travellers compete to complete four objectives by travelling back in time to alter four separate time-lines, and interfere with each other's plans.

To play the game, you will need :
- 1 A4 printout of the board (see files or images section)
- 4 red counters
- 4 blue counters
- 10 black counters
- 1 D6

Rules are printed on the board, and transcribed here :

Place player pieces on the beginning of any timeline (I - IV, coloured), and a marker on the beginning of the clock track (X).

At the beginning of each round, advance the clock marker one hour.
If the end of the clock track is reached by the first clock marker, add a second at X, and continue advancing this, so that 24 hours are played.
When the second clock marker reaches the end of its track, the game ends.

The player with the greatest number of achievements (A or B) wins.
If more than one player is tied for the greatest number of achievements, the player with the least pieces wins.
If more than one player shares the lowest number of pieces, the player whose oldest piece has advanced the farthest through time wins.

In turn, move your earliest piece (that nearest to X along the time-lines I - IV) forward one space, or roll 1D6.
On a roll of 6, you may move any piece on the board (with the exception of achievements) one space in any direction along its time-line.
On any other roll, place a new piece on any time-line, that number of spaces back in time from your earliest piece, counting from the previous space.
If the new piece is placed beyond the starting space, it is lost in time, and your turn ends.

If you land level with another of your pieces, remove the older of the two pieces, and collect the achievement associated with its time-line if you have not already.
If you land on the same space as another piece, move that piece to the equivalent time on any other time-line.

For a co-op game, use only one clock counter (12 hours), and ignore one of the scoring tracks.
96865.name: Time Bastards

96866.name: Nick Dubronski jagt Sinto Manao
96866.description: "Nick Dubronski jagt Sinto Manao" is a cooperative adventure game themed around the german amateur audio drama series "Nick Dubronski". Players choose there character from 18 special agents. The agents have to fight together against the super-demon Sinto Manao. Sinto Manao tries to gain his force by controlling other dimensions and recruit an army of terror. During the course of the game, players will upgrade their agents by acquiring skills, allies, items, and weapons. It's up to the players to clean out the world by fighting many different types of henchman, but their main goal is to close portals to other dimensions that are opening up around the world. At the end there is a final battle against Sinto Manao. Are the agents well-prepared?

96867.name: Encounter (Issue 4 - Mar 2011)
96867.description:
table of contents:
8, A Darkened World
The World of the Dark Crystal™ for Classic D&D® Part I

15, Lon’s Splendid Arbor
A versatile spell for the Labyrinth Lord™ RPG

16, Knights & Wizards
Classic Dungeons & Dragons® for kids!

19, Quest for the Enchanted Sword
A short adventure for young players of D&D®

22, Dragons of Lore
Put some Norse myth into your Classic D&D® dragons

25, DM’s Toolkit: Random Curiosities
20 dungeon oddities for your Labyrinth Lord™ game

27, Truesight
Views from the Old School blogosphere

96868.name: Croc 2 (GBC)
videogameversion: North American Game Boy Color edition
96868.description:
Croc2 is a video game released in 1999, is the sequel to Croc: Legend of the Gobbos, developed by Argonaut Software between 1998 and 1999, and published by Fox Interactive. Croc 2 was released on Game Boy Color, Windows, and PlayStation. A Dreamcast release was planned but eventually canceled. The plot revolves around Croc searching for missing parents, and saving the Inventor Gobbo from Baron Dante.

Source: Wikipedia, "Croc 2", available under the CC-BY-SA License.

96869.description:
You must know the rules of Cribbage to play this game, but the scoring system means that quite different tactics are required.
Each player tries to score goals and for a shot on goal, you need to score dozens (or more) with your hand. Opponent will get a chance to save the shot.
Further rules cover the actual player 'on the pitch' who scored the goal. The time in the match when the goal was scored. Penalties, and Home Advantage.

Published by Games Unlimited Ltd. in their house fanzine Random.
96869.name: Crib Football

96870.description:
In Kunitori! Tenka: Is the World on Fire?, the players are feudal lords in medieval Japan, once again fighting for unification of the lands. In this deck-building game, you must use your tacticians, allies and money effectively to buy cards such as Cavalry, Fortresses and Gold, gradually building your deck of cards.

As the game nears its end, players can take command of their generals and troops to go to battle against the other players, trying to gain as many lands as possible. This battle heavily influences the game. All after fights of the samurai end and players tally their victory points, will you be the strongest feudal lord?

Integrates with:

Kuni Tori!
96870.name: Kunitori! Is the World on Fire?

96871.name: Anomaly: Warzone Earth
videogamehonor: 2011 Apple Design Awards Best Macintosh Game of the Year Winner
96871.description:
The game is set in the near future, where sections of an alien spacecraft have crash-landed in several major cities around the world, including Baghdad and Tokyo.

The player assumes the role of the commander of an armor battalion sent to investigate anomalies that have occurred in the vicinity of the wreckage and gather information on what is happening in the affected areas, as the anomalies are interfering with radar and satellite imagery - and to neutralize any threats that may exist within the anomalies' field of influence.

Players control a convoy of vehicles investigating anomalies around sections of a downed alien spacecraft, which are protected by various types of defensive towers that have to be destroyed. The style of the gameplay has been described as "reverse tower defense", "tower attack", and "tower offense".

Source: Wikipedia, "Anomaly Warzone Earth", available under the CC-BY-SA License.

96872.name: Fire Emblem: Sword of Seals
96872.description:
Fire Emblem: Fūin no Tsurugi​ (ファイアーエムブレム封印の剣, translated as Fire Emblem: The Sword of Seal in Japanese-published sources and Fire Emblem: The Binding Blade in American-published sources) is a tactical role-playing game developed by Intelligent Systems and published by Nintendo. The game was released on March 29, 2002 in Japan, is the sixth game in the Fire Emblem series and the first of three games in the series that have appeared on Nintendo's Game Boy Advance handheld. Its working title was Fire Emblem: Ankoku no Miko (暗黒の巫女, Maiden of Darkness). It stars Roy, who previously appeared in Super Smash Bros. Melee.

Fire Emblem is a turn-based tactical role-playing game in which players move a small group of units around a square-based grid, battling their enemies in order to complete a certain predefined objective. It is reminiscent of other tactical RPGs with features such as character classes and the ability to level up. For more information, refer to the Fire Emblem gameplay basics.

Source: Wikipedia, "Fire Emblem: Fūin no Tsurugi," available under the CC-BY-SA License.

96873.name: Ravenwood Fair
videogamehonor: 2011 D.I.C.E. Social Networking Game/Web Based Game of the Year Nominee
96873.description:
User Summary

The player gains possession of the tree-filled land of Ravenwood and is tasked with clearing the land and setting up a fair in time for the upcoming royal wedding.

Ravenwood Fair is a social, casual online game. Tasks expend character energy, which regenerates slowly, and the player slowly levels through clearing trees, defeating monsters, purchasing buildings, games and decorations for the fair, and completing quests.

The player can add 'neighbors' (other players, each playing on their own Ravenwood map) and can visit their fairs, trade gifts, assist in tasks, or simply in order to meet certain quest conditions.

96874.name: Generation of Chaos
96874.description:
User Summary:

Welcome to Never Land. The game boasts both standard RPG and mass battles. All elements of the game are split to accommodate both modes.

96875.name: Black/Matrix II
96875.description:
While the fictional world of Black/Matrix II is again fantasy-based, it is distinct from the original game. It is divided into three realms - heaven, home to white-winged angels; the human world, inhabited by relatively weak, wingless people; and hell, where black-winged devils reside. The three realms are largely independent and their natives are suspicious of the other realms. Many humans have been convinced of the evil nature of Hell by the angels, but for all their fearsome powers neither the devils nor Hell itself are inherently malevolent. Hell is ruled by the beautiful and compassionate Jenarose, who is said to love humankind more than anyone in the world.

Source: Wikipedia, "Black/Matrix (video game series)," available under the CC-BY-SA License.

96876.name: Black/Matrix 00
96876.description:
"The world of Black/Matrix is fictional and fantasy-based, and in it the forces of Hell won a decisive war against the forces of Heaven. The victorious devils rewrote history and redesigned society to suit their purposes, reversing the concepts of good and evil. The descendants of the devils, known as black-wings because of the bat-like wings that grow from their backs, rule over the white-wing descendants of the angels, whom they treat as sub-human slaves. In their society love is considered the worst of crimes, and any one found guilty of love or kindness is hunted and punished."

Source: Wikipedia, "http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Black_Matrix,"; available under the CC-BY-SA License.

96877.name: Newmarket
96877.description:
A card game that is similar to the traditional playing card game of Racing Demon. One player is the Bookmaker and offers odds on each of the horses in any one race.
For the race, cards are turned over and the horse named advances along the 'course'. And there are wild cards that affect the race; Jockey Falls, Little Brown Dog, Whip, and Spur.
There is no skill at all apart from betting wisely or, if you are the Bookmaker, offering the right odds so that you can make a profit

96879.name: Modem Wars
96879.description:
Modem Wars is a 1988 real-time tactical war game developed by Ozark Softscape and published by Electronic Arts for the IBM PC and Commodore 64 platforms.

Modem Wars was played over a modem connection between two machines (via telephone or null modem serial connection), with both players controlling a group of robotic units trying to eliminate the opponent's mobile Command Center (COMCEN). Features such as fog of war, varied unit types, terrain, and formations were implemented.

The game was originally developed under the title "Sport of War"; Computer Gaming World noted this was the easiest way to understand the game, saying "You play the game as a wargame, but you accumulate points as if it were a sports game." The name was changed to Modem Wars to call attention to how the game is intended to be played against other humans via modem. The computer AI opponent is referred to as a "solo trainer", and CGW recommended against buying the game for those planning to only play against the computer.

Of specific technical interest, Modem Wars has been lauded for its mechanism of using 4-byte packets for each 'move', deltas to determine game states, and storage of those deltas to allow for after-game replays.

Source: Wikipedia, "Modem Wars", available under the CC-BY-SA License.

96880.name: Gold Stock
96880.description:
This game is composed of eighteen wooden chips (pawns) in two colors (nine for each player) and a board with seventy-seven cells, of which eighteen are marked with two different colors.

Each player place his pawns in their respective colour cells and the game begins. Players move their pawns alternately one by one. The movement is one square forward or sideways, but never diagonally or backward. It’s forbidden not move a pawn in the player's turn.

When a player, after moving a pawn, trap a chip of the other player between two of his own, that chip is removed. Only one chip can be removed in each turn.

The game ends when no piece can be moved forward, being all in the last cell. The player who gets the most pawns to the last row of the board, opposite to the area in which he started, wins the game.

This game is part of the rare "Club series" from NAC, a company more known for his wargames than for this kind of abstract games. The other known titles from this series are: The Backbone, Manhattan and Daiquiri

96881.name: Egypt II: The Heliopolis Prophecy
videogamedeveloper: Editions de la Réunion des musées nationaux
96881.description:
User Summary:

The player takes on the role of a young priestess named Tifet, who is charged with finding a cure for a deadly plague that has begun spreading in Heliopolis.
Tifet has been raised by a doctor and is intimately familiar with medicine herself, but the source of the plague eludes both of them. And so she starts a quest by order of the Pharaoh to determine the origin of the plague, and prevent it from delaying the building of his temple.

96882.name: Dawn of Worlds
96882.description:
From the introduction:
We would become the gods of our own fantasy world. We would raise it up from the meager foundations of stone and water. We would raise up great civilizations, set them at war, guide them in science and magic, and give them leaders. And we would do it in about six hours. From this singular idea arose the game which you now see before you.

Within the guidelines of Dawn of Worlds are the tools and the advice by which a few ordinary people can set themselves up with ultimate power for an evening and leave you with a complete, detailed fantasy world. It will, if you make use of it, give you a world with complete landscapes, history, cultures, and characters. And it will be fun, too.

96883.name: Radar 2000
96883.description:
This title covers two different games:
- a classical battleship-like game, which, by using tracking system by means of polar co-ordinates, is more modern than former types;
- a "battle of missiles", new game in which success depends mainly on deduction and method.

Both games require different printed forms, but are provided with the same support for two Radar screens: the first one is used to "emit" missiles and to track firing against the enemy, the second one to place ships or missiles and to "receive" enemy firing.

96884.name: Safecracker: The Ultimate Puzzle Adventure
96884.description:
The games story revolves around a safe cracker, being hired by the family of a recently deceased billionaire and oil magnate, Duncan W. Adams. The player has been employed to find the will of Duncan W. Adams, by cracking the 35 safes that were in his possession

Source: Wikipedia, "Safecracker: The Ultimate Puzzle Adventure", available under the CC-BY-SA License.

96885.name: Cloaks and Daggers
96885.description:
website blurb:
Cloaks and Daggers is role-playing game where the characters take the roles of spies in a spy organization. The players are let loose in a large GR (game runner) made world where they go do anything they want. If the players are at a loss about what to do, then the GR gives them an “involving event” to get things going again.

The players give their characters an “advantage” which is like a class in other role-playing games. They pick from the categories like talent, trait, and possession and then give themselves powers with it. i.e. a 5% chance to make someone believe them.

Combat is handled like this. Characters declare their action, which have a time to complete in seconds. The GR counts off each second and finished actions happen at the end of the seconds. They can pick from a list of actions or use their own. Combat is not intended to be a major part of this game.

A section on spy equipment and tactics is provided to give the players some sense of what they could do as spies. Without it, they would not know what to do more than a normal person off the street would.

I hope you enjoy this role-playing game as much as I have enjoyed making it

96886.name: Tifon 4
96886.description:
4 spinning tops for 4 different games, that's essentially Tifon (Typhoon) 4.

Although other elements like marbles or a shooting platform are included, the metal spinnings tops, identified as "spaceships" in the gamer's manual, are the main element in the different games described:

-Cosmic Soccer: The marbles are placed in the center of the field and, then, a special spinning top is released on it, throwing the marbles into the different scored goals on each side of the field. The player with the most points, wins.

-Starship stop: A spinning top it's thrown into a flat surface and the players try to "catch" it with the shooting platform and its magnetic projectile. 10 points are given to the one who catch the top and 5 to the one who just knock it down.

-Competition: The players spin their tops and the one with the top that falls last, wins.

-Fight: The four tops are thrown into the field and crash against each other. The player with the last top standing, wins.

The manual encourages the players to create it's own games and variations, and suggest some possibilities.

96887.name: Imperial General
96887.description:
In Imperial General, the armies are equal, the odds are equal, the strengths are equal, the difference is you!
In Imperial General both sides have identical decks and start in identical setups. Then, each turn, the players select what their next formation change, or order, will be for the next turn. The changes are compared and a matrix on the bottom of each card shows how may points your opponent loses.
Rounds continue until one side has lost an entire company. THen the game ends and the side with the most points (men) remaining-wins.
Imperial General is part of the Warcoach Games "10 Minute War Game" series.

96888.name: Carrion Crown
96888.description:
From Publisher's website:

With the Carrion Crown Adventure Path, managing editor Wes Schneider has captured the essence of popular movies such as Bram Stoker's Dracula, Mary Shelley's Frankenstein, and Van Helsing in Golarion with the able assistance of authors known for their love of horror. The realm of Ustalav brought to life in this Adventure Path is the perfect place to set your own game of gothic horror and our latest GameMastery Item Card deck provides the perfect props. These detailed cards illustrate some of the creepier things lurking in the dust and cobwebs of your favorite mad scientist's laboratory.

96889.name: Senator Please
96889.description: Players move around the board to complete with all "Senators" and 48 state questions (which is the amount of states in the USA at the time). They have to collect enough cards and answer "special" question to become President and win the game.

96890.description:
When backgammon became a fad in the early seventies, the game went from that thing on the back of inexpensive checker boards to the gambling rage of the jet set.

This solitaire game was created to cash in on the craze. Sixty pre-programmed games have been divided into four courses of fifteen games. Place one of the games into the tray. Using the slides in the frame of the tray, the player only sees one move at a time. After sizing up any given situation, the player advances a slide to see what backgammon champion Tim Holland would have done.

The game contains the tray, a really cheap backgammon set, thirty two game cards and rules.
96890.name: Autobackgammon

96891.name: Spello
96891.description:
The gameboard is a nineteen-by-nineteen grid with the corners missing; the first and last rows and columns are elongated. In this elongated spaces, players may place more than one letter to make their words.

From a pool of letters, the players determine which letters will be randomly added to their hands. The players, in turn, add their letters to the grid to make words in crossword fashion.

The game contains one sheet or rules and nineteen games printed in ten sheets of paper. The game is consistent with Robert Mansfield’s packaging that allows a complete set to be stuffed into a standard business envelope.

96892.name: The KINGPIN! Game
96892.description:
The PRIMARY OBJECTIVE:
"Finish them! Before they finish you!"

Gain the reign of the nefarious organized underground.

Rollers (players) will gamble and make deals, purchase and flip (sell) from the various high-end illicit contraband markets (on domestic soil/US & foreign lands).

This is a roll-and-move game. Rollers roll the dice and move their game piece throughout The KINGPIN! Game world's cities, states and countries. As rollers travel The KINGPIN! Game world they are allowed to buy or sell available products, pick a PUSH YOUR LUCK card (like "chance" or "community chest") which gives rollers a 50/50 chance of getting or losing monies. Rollers can also gamble in "La$ Vega$", "3Card MONT3 CARLO", or "AC", for their chance at the 7 / 11 jackpot roll. Rollers must increase their wealth and their worth while eliminating all street competition.

Rollers can hire one of The KINGPIN! Game's paid "KILLA$" to attempt to assassinate other rollers in The KINGPIN! Game, done by paying for hire - The KINGPIN! "KILLA$" (hit-men/assassins). The KINGPIN! "KILLA$" are hired killers in The KINGPIN! Game that operate for various fees/costs {$75,000 - $1M}.

The goal of The KINGPIN! Game is to be the last one standing! The solo survivor ~ the realized vision of the primary objective...

The KINGPIN!

The KINGPIN! Game comes with:
The Official The KINGPIN! game rule book and soundtrack
(hard copy of the rule book and CD with rules set to KINGPIN! MU$IK as well as a The KINGPIN! Game related score/sound Track) on one CD

96893.name: Metal Slug 4/5
96893.description:
User Summary

A compilation of Metal Slug 4 & 5.

96894.name: World Heroes Anthology
96894.description:
World Heroes Anthology (known as World Heroes Gorgeous in Japan) is a game compilation, which includes all four games from ADK's World Heroes series, which were a part of the early Neo Geo titles from SNK. The four games presented here World Heroes, World Heroes 2, World Heroes 2 Jet, and World Heroes Perfect.

The compilation was released for PlayStation 2 on March 11, 2008.

Source: Wikipedia, "World Heroes Anthology", available under the CC-BY-SA License.

96895.name: World Heroes
96895.description:
World Heroes is controlled with three of the four buttons ("A" to punch, "B" to kick and "C" to throw) used along with an 8-way joystick on the Neo Geo MVS arcade cabinet. The punch and kick buttons are pressure-sensitive, so the harder the players press, the more powerful the punches or kicks become, while lighter taps can create weaker, but faster punches or kicks. The throw button C, if close enough to the opponent, grabs and throws the opponent across the stage; however, if standing near either side of a stage, the opponent would be tossed the opposite direction. Introduced in the fighting game genre by World Heroes are some abilities exclusive to some characters that were used in several later fighting games, such as multi-jumping using Hanzou and Fuuma, and shooting projectiles from the air using Rasputin.

There are two different play modes for players to choose from: "Normal Game" and "Death Match". In "Normal Game", players have to select one of the eight playable characters in the roster, and defeat the other seven playable characters in a random order, followed by a battle against the final boss Geegus (misspelled as "Gee Gus" in localized English versions), all by using the chosen character. If the player loses a battle, he or she will decide whether to continue (by inserting coin) or quit. If the player defeats an opponent, he or she will move on the the next opponent; however, if the player wins against the final boss Geegus, the game will show the ending of the player's chosen character, followed by the "game over" screen, and back to attract mode; however, if a player beats a high score, he or she will type in three letters or text symbols to record his or her record before the "game over" screen appears. In "Death Match", players will fight in a ring with environmental hazards such as electricity and fire surrounding it, which players must avoid while fighting. Players also can force their opponents against the environmental hazards using several moves.

Source: Wikipedia, "World Heroes (arcade game)", available under the CC-BY-SA License.

96896.name: World Heroes 2
96896.description:
World Heroes 2 borrows most of the elements of its predecessor, such as the same three out of four button layout, movements and motion commands performed using an 8-way joystick, and the "Normal Game" and "Death Match" modes. However, the "C" button can either be used to throw when close enough to the opponent, or taunt against the opponent. New additions include some new characters, new and modified moves and fighting statistics added to the original eight playable characters returning from the first World Heroes, projectile-reflecting, counter-grabbing, air-dashing and a faster movement.

In "Normal Game" mode, after selecting one of the fourteen playable characters, the object is to first defeat all six playable characters introduced in World Heroes 2, then defeat four of the original eight characters introduced in the original World Heroes chosen by the game randomly. After that, the player must defeat the two bosses, Neo Geegus and Dio to win the game. The rule in each battle against a character, like in most fighting games at the time of its release, requires the players to win two-of three rounds to completely win against the opponent. If the timer runs out before anyone is knocked out, the one with the most health in his or her lifebars wins.

In "Death Match" mode, the object of this mode is the same as "Normal Game" mode, but with new stages that feature new environmental hazards and a unique lifebar. Unlike most fighting games at the time, the lifebar in "Death Match" mode has a different rule. If the player hits his or her opponent, the arrow on the lifebar will move toward the opponent's side at a distance depending on certain moves performed against the opponent. If the arrow scrolls at the end of the opponent's side, he or she loses. If the arrow is perfectly in the middle with the time running out, the battle becomes a draw.

Source: Wikipedia, "World Heroes 2", available under the CC-BY-SA License.

96897.name: World Heroes Perfect
96897.description:
World Heroes Perfect is a fighting game that was created by ADK in 1995 for the Neo-Geo, it is also the first and only title in the series that was only ported to the Sega Saturn. Ironically, it is also the last game of the World Heroes series.

Source: Wikipedia, "World Heroes Perfect", available under the CC-BY-SA License.

96899.name: Fire ProWrestling S: 6Men Scramble
96899.description:
User Summary

Fire ProWrestling S: 6Men Scramble is the Sega Saturn version of the venerable Fire Pro Wrestling series of Japanese Professional Wrestling simulation games.

This installment was the first to handle more than 4 wrestlers in the ring at once. Hence, the title is 6Men Scramble. Additionally, if one had access to a multi-tap or two, this game gave the option of playing with up to 6 friends locally.

96901.description:
In February 1942, President Franklin D. Roosevelt issued the first of a series of executive orders that would send over 100,000 American citizens to concentration camps. One year later, a Japanese-American regiment began to form. The 442nd Regimental Combat Team, eventually also including the 100th Infantry Battalion formed in Hawai'i, racked up more decorations than any regiment in American military history: 18,143 awards for battlefield valor, including 21 Medals of Honor.

Go for Broke is a book supplement for the Panzer Grenadier series, with 20 new scenarios by Mike Perryman depicting the actions of America's toughest fighters in the last years of the Second World War. There are also 77 new die-cut and mounted playing pieces depicting this regiment in its own color scheme.

Go for Broke is not a complete product: ownership of 1940: The Fall of France, Elsenborn Ridge and Battle of the Bulge is required to enjoy all of the scenarios.
96901.name: Panzer Grenadier: Go for Broke

96902.name: B-Boy
videogamehonor: 2007 British Academy Game Awards Best Soundtrack of the Year Nominee
96902.description:
User Summary

B-boy is a rhythm game for the PS2 and PSP that is based on break dancing. Players attempt to rise through the ranks of B-Boys and B-Girls to make a name for themselves on the world stage. They do so by competing in dance-offs with other dancers. There are a number of different moves accessible through different button combinations, and players need to keep the beat using the shoulder buttons as well. Poorly timed manoeuvres will cost points and cause the dancer to stumble.

96903.name: Babe
96903.description:
User Summary

Babe is an adventure game based on the movie of the same name. Players control Babe as he endeavours to get to the sheep herding tournament in the big city. In order to compete, Babe needs to herd all the sheep to the tournament, travelling through many different locations including a hotel, a hospital, and an airport. He must approach the animals, and when Babe snorts, the sheep will move away from him.

96905.name: Rollespilsmagasinet Fønix (Issue 12 - Mar/Apr 1996)
rpgissuearticle: Få dem på krogen part II
High Tech og dog til rotterne
Rollespil med blåt blod i årene

96906.name: ROLLE|SPIL (Issue 6 - Apr 2011)
rpgissuearticle: Den bedste dag for rollespil nogensinde
Manden af stål - not so much...
96906.description: Cover photo by Mike Ditlevsen. Cover model is Sanne Harder.

96907.name: EIC League
96907.description:
EIC League is a tactical combat / RPG crossover that is completely customizable. You add your own dice and playing field to the EIC League rules that you download, and you are ready to go.

Every player is assigned the same number of credits (a budget) that they have to spend to buy and customize their units.

Players design units (either bipeds or tanks), equip them with the 7 ratings they need (body material, attack, defense, power, speed, detection & ECM), then outfit them with weapons, shielding, and special movements. After the units are completed, they pit their team against one or more opponents. The game is like chess on steroids!

The infinite combinations of weapons, movements and defenses against the other team's weapons movements and defenses makes for a unique playing experience each and every game.

Unit design can take up to 2 hours for first time players, and play time can range anywhere from 30 minutes to 4 hours. The object of the game is to obliterate the opposition and collect credits for rewards. With those credits, you can buy more units or upgrade your existing units through the roof.

Strategy is the key to winning. Do you use a bunch of fast and light units or just work with a couple of super strong slow units, or go with a mix of everything? Depending on what you do and what each opponent does, you can battle for hours or you can make a fatal mistake and have things end very quickly. No two games are alike!

96908.name: Legend of the Galactic Heroes: My Conquest is a Sea of Stars
96908.description:
Based off of the cult classic series of science fiction novels, Legend of the Galactic heroes tells the story of two empires in space, fighting a war for total control. On one side, the Free Planets Alliance, a corrupt democracy lead by a charismatic fraud, and on the other side, The Empire, a Benevolent Monarchy, lead by the Imperial Kaiser.

Legend of the Galactic Heroes: My Conquest is a Sea of Stars. puts you in command of one of these nations, on the eve of war, will you come out victorious, or will the underhanded dealings of your neighbor with the neutral world of Phezzan put you at a loss.

Game play is based around two boards, one is the strategic board where you command all the resources of your nation, and the other is the tactical board, where you can fight out the battles between massive fleets, numbering in the thousands.

Complexity - Moderate, only slightly more complex then a game of Axis and Allies.

Length - In Excess of Ten hours for a full game, individual battles take up to thirty minutes or so.

Suitability for Solitaire Play - Moderate, some elements of the game revolve around hidden units, but the rules for that are easily removed.

96909.name: Mysteria Matris Oblitae
96909.description:
From the scenario:

"Turning up at the University of Mexico City in the summer of 1929 is a truly odd photograph received by postal courier from the town of Tula, Mexico. This photograph shows a bizarre creature surrounded by Mexicans and Indians. The beast, a pale misshapen alien thing, obviously succumbed to some sort of gunfire which wracked and punctured its odd crustacean-like body. It is clearly dead, and the locals show no fear in their expressions, only awe towards the beast which is approximately the same size as a medium-sized dog."

96911.name: Nationale 7: Lapalisse
96911.description:
You are driving through the city of Lapalisse and try to collect two items and find one truth. When you get your items and truth, you rush out from the city. First one who leaves wins the game.
You move your car by pushing new tiles to the Nationale 7. When your car is in the right place you park and collect an item or leave Nationale 7 and turn to side roads in Lapalisse. You collect or lose the truth by driving to a "truth" tile.

96912.name: Resort World
96912.description:
User Summary

Working on their own islands, players of Resort World are given a plot of land and an old neglected pier and tasked to build from these humble beginnings and create a holiday resort / amusement park for tourists.

Resort World is a slow casual online game. Building constructions takes hours, and there are hours between revenue returns from the buildings, allowing the player to play the game as a casual pastime, not an intensive play at the computer.

The player can invite 'neighbors' who work on their resorts independently, but alongside the player. Players can visit their neighbor's islands, perform small tasks there, contribute to some projects, and gift items, but actual interaction at the management level is limited.

boardgamehonor: 2011 Lys Passioné Finalist
2011 Spiel des Jahres Kennerspiel Game of the Year Nominee
2012 Nederlandse Spellenprijs Nominee
2012 Nederlandse Spellenprijs Winner
96913.description:
From the designer of Glen More comes a new title published by Queen Games: Lancaster.

In 1413, the new king of England, Henry V of Lancaster, has ambitious plans: The unification of England and the conquest of the French crown! Each player takes the role of an ambitious aristocratic family. Who will be the best supporter of this young king, and the most powerful Lord of his time?

In Lancaster the players want to proceed from simply being a Lord to the most powerful ally of the king. They may achieve this by developing their own knighthood as well as by clever deployment of individual knights in the counties of England, at their own castle, and to conflicts with France. In parliament, they try to push laws from which they will benefit themselves most. The player with the most power points at the end of the game is the winner.

Every turn, players send their knights to the different locations:
• Counties, where they compete with knights from other players for rewards and the favor of the nobles.
• The castle, to receive income or new knights.
• Into conflict with France, where all players combine their power and try to gain power points.

In the counties the strength of the knights is important as you can remove the knight of another player by placing a knight of your own with higher strength in the same location.
boardgameversion: Queen Games English / French First Edition
96913.name: Lancaster
boardgamepodcastepisode: EP38：Rose Rumble
Episode 15 -- Cramer vs. Cramer vs. Cramer, et al
Episode 43 – The return
Episodio 7 – Los primeros juegos
ET75: BANG! BANG! BANG! Esto es una herida superficial para un Lupino
Exploring Games, Episode 7: Stretcing Lancaster Too Far
Heavy Cardboard Episode 18 – Agricola
Heavy Cardboard Episode 39 – Top 50 Favorite Games of Right Now
Lancaster (Queen Games): Spiele-Podcast Nr. 195
The Good The Board and The Backers: Episode 84 “P500 vs Kickstarter”

96914.name: Granada
96914.description:
Granada is a 1990 shoot 'em up video game developed by Wolf Team and published by Telenet Japan in Japan first for the Sharp X68000 and later the Sega Mega Drive, with a North American Sega Genesis release by Renovation Products the following year. The player controls a tank from an overhead perspective, shooting at enemy tanks and weapon stations. The play field allows scrolling in all directions, and the player must navigate through each level to find and destroy all targets before advancing. Granada is sometimes mistakenly referred to as "XGranadaX" or "Granada X" because of ambiguity in the design of the logo.

Source: Wikipedia, "Granada (game)", available under the CC-BY-SA License.

96915.name: Warrior of Rome
96915.description:
Warrior of Rome, also known as Caesar no Yabou, ("Ambition of Caesar"), is a real-time strategy video game for the Sega Genesis. The game is a fictional story about the adventures of Julius Caesar and the Roman army during his reign as general in the year 48 BCE. The game had a sequel, Warrior of Rome II.

The player had four maps (based in Egypt) to command their troops over. Players are given control over each unit of troops on the Section Map. The player can select six different options for each troop unit including approach speed, retreat to allow the unit to regain strength or setting traps. Once the troops have encountered an enemy unit, the Battle Screen appears showing a side shot of the player's troops in combat. The player can save their game progress or use a password system at the end of a completed stage.

Source: Wikipedia, "Warrior of Rome," available under the CC-BY-SA License.

96916.name: Abel-Klingers "Grosse Fahrschule"
96916.description:
Goal: Be the first, who visits all 12 lettered points (A-M) avoiding major mistakes

1 Preparing the map first you have to cut trees, buildings, a bridge and glue/insert these into the
board, place policemen...
2 Follow the streets/roads in recommended directions by rolling the die
3 Stop at lettered places (and policemen)
4 Explain the traffic signs you pass by; various mistakes will lead to penalties

rpgissuearticle: Fuel for the Fire, Editors Notes
Tuckered Out—Movie Reviews from a Unique Perspective

3, Take a Tip from FRED by Chad LaNier

17, Upcoming White Wolf Releases

96918.name: Unsere Lufthansa
96918.description:
Goal: Be the first to travel with 'Lufthansa GDR' from Berlin via Praha to Budapest

1. Choose your coloured plastic plane and roll the die by turns - you may start with a '6' at once, otherwise follow a circuit - Kicking your teammate(s) is not allowed
2. Follow instructions if you land on a marked area
3. Stopover in Praha
4. Step out in Budapest and win - that's it

17, Upcoming White Wolf Releases

96920.name: Hallen arkaner Macht
96920.description:
(user summary)
This sourcebook details life in 15 wizard schools of Aventuria.
Described are the academies of the cities of:
Belhanka
Brabak
Donnerbach
Fasar
Festum
Gareth (two academies)
Lowangen
Kuslik
Methumis
Mherwed
Perricum
Riva
Thorwal
Zorgan

96921.name: GameMastery Map Pack: Crypts
96921.description:
From the publisher's website:

Exploring ancient burial grounds and protecting the corpses of the honored dead from unholy transformation are standard fare for bold adventurers. But no Game Master wants to spend valuable game time drawing every looted grave and undead-haunted sepulcher. Fortunately, with Paizo Publishing’s latest GameMastery Map Pack, you don’t have to! Inside, you’ll find 18 captivating 5" × 8" map tiles, all specially coated to allow you to use wet erase and dry erase markers, then remove ink with ease!

* This set includes: Catacombs
* Noble's Crypt
* Ghoul Lair
* Defiled Mausoleum
* Soldier's Tomb

Game Masters shouldn’t waste their time sketching maps every time an adventure calls for a haunted tomb. With GameMastery Map Pack: Crypts, you’ll be ready next time your players go dungeon crawling! Plus, combine this set with GameMastery Flip-Mat: Necropolis to show your crypts in the context of a huge cemetery!

For use with all tabletop roleplaying and miniatures games and usable by experienced GMs and novices alike, this product fits perfectly into any Game Master’s arsenal.

96922.name: The Midnight Mirror
96922.description:
From the back of the book:

The sleepy town of Karpad in shadow-haunted Nidal has long been overseen by the Boroi family, and until a few weeks ago, the citizens under Baron Stepan Boroi's rule have lived uneventful lives of relative peace. Recently, however, the outbreak of a virulent and fatal disease and a number of mysterious disappearances have left the people of Karpad paranoid and fearful. Even Baron Stepan has been acting strangely, and now the tenuous balance of racial tensions between Karpad's human and fetchling populations stands on the verge of collapsing into total anarchy. Can the PCs uncover the root of Karpad's problems and put an end to the deadly virus, the terrifying disappearances, and the miasma of fear and distrust that threatens to overwhelm the region?

Written by Sam Zeitlin, 2011's winner of Paizo Publishing's annual RPG Superstar contest—in which unpublished authors compete before a panel of celebrity game designers and legions of their peers for the chance to write a Pathfinder Module—The Midnight Mirror takes players from a mysterious investigation into a shadowy demiplane prison and pits them against the evil forces of both darkness and light.

The Midnight Mirror is an investigation and horror adventure for 4th-level characters, written for the Pathfinder Roleplaying Game and compatible with the 3.5 edition of the world’s oldest RPG. This volume also contains a fully-detailed gazetteer of the town of Karpad and a new magic item that are sure to add depth and flavor to any campaign.

96923.name: Feast of Ravenmoor
96923.description:
From the back of the book:

Let the Feast Begin!

For decades, the tiny village of Ravenmoor has existed quietly on the upper reaches of the Lampblack River, far from the centers of civilization in Varisia. Linked to the outside world only by an overgrown, mostly forgotten trail, the villagers are comfortable with their isolation. Their ways are humble, quaint, and at times odd, and when travelers come, they find the town awkward and unmemorable. Certainly, the lack of a village inn, the oppressive humidity, and the bug-infested moors and swamps that surround the village do little to encourage visitors. When a clerk in the city of Magnimar discovers that, due to a clerical error, the village of Ravenmoor hasn’t paid taxes in years, a tax collector is sent to the distant community to settle accounts with its mayor. When the tax collector fails to return, however, a group of adventurers must travel to the town during its Founders’ Feast celebration to investigate his disappearance. Did he really make off with the taxes for himself, as the villagers suspect? Or did he never make it out of Ravenmoor at all?

Feast of Ravenmoor is an adventure for 3rd-level characters, written for the Pathfinder Roleplaying Game and compatible with the 3.5 edition of the world’s oldest RPG. It features a terrifying adventure set in a rural village in the frontier realm of Varisia, and a brand-new monster eager to torment and frighten unsuspecting adventurers.

96924.name: Lands of the Linnorm Kings
96924.description:
From the publisher's website:

This in-depth 64-page gazetteer explores the legendary Lands of the Linnorm Kings, a northern realm of larger-than-life adventure where Viking kings earn the right to rule by defeating enormous, primeval dragons - linnorms. From the rugged western islands of the Ironbound Archipelago to the battleworn expanse known as Hagreach in the east, this volume contains detailed treatments of all the major locales in the region. Numerous adventure sites and campaign themes are explored in detail, such as remote troll-haunted ruins, mysterious locations linked to the eerie realm of the fey, and even a sample linnorm hunt. Rules on weregild (fees for hostages or slain enemies), effigies (mundane and magical ways to strike fear into your enemies), and reputation in this ferocious land are explored, as are several new monsters and pre-built enemy NPCs, such as remorseless longship captains, berserkers, new trolls, and the most powerful linnorm in the land - dread Fafnheir!

96925.name: Psi-5 Trading Company
96925.description:
From the Back Cover

Living on the edge of an eternal galaxy battling opponents who seem to be reading your mind, you are about to captain your ship through one of the great edge-of-your-seat adventures of the 35th Century.

Intergalactic Carnage

Sitting on a mother lode of rich mining deposits, a new quadrant, called the Parvin Frontier, is a mecca for settlers, entrepreneurs on both sides of the law and some of the worst scum in the universe.

These space carrions have been the scourge of the shipping lanes. And, as things stand now, they are on the brink of starving out the entire quadrant and holding it hostage.

No wonder the inhabitants of the Parvin Frontier will pay almost anything to anyone who can get through to them with a freight ship full of supplies from the outside world.

But, it's a tall order to fill, even for the experienced captain of the Psi 5 Trading Co. Because, needless to say, these marauders are not going to take too kindly to any last ditch efforts to spoil their little intergalactic carnage.

So, if you're ripe for a stiff challenge and feel comfortable in the role of Space Freighter Captain, your ship just came in.

96926.name: Inner Sea Magic
96926.description:
From the publisher's website:

Magic has suffused the Inner Sea region for thousands of years. This book takes a detailed look at the magical traditions of the Inner Sea, including rules for magic variants (from hideous fleshwarping rituals to the wild and unpredictable surges of primal magic), examinations of how magic is taught (be it in schools, temples, guilds, or secret societies), and how the spellcasters of the region have chosen to specialize in various forms of magic.

This 64-page book presents two new oracle mysteries, 18 new archetypes for spellcasting classes, a pair of prestige classes (the cypher mage and the divine scion), and a wide selection of unique, unusual, and exciting new spells for all who would seek to master the art of magic.

96927.name: Geus en Spanjool
96927.description:
This game is situated in the low countries during the revolt against Spain, resulting in the independency of the Dutch Republic.
One player takes the Spanish side and the other the Dutch. Control of the land is achieved by controlling the various cities. To signify the control each city is covered with a chit which has a Spanish side and a Dutch side.
At the beginning of the game the players decide on the number of rounds they will play (about 10 rounds per hour can be played, 20 to 30 round are recommended) and a die is rolled for each city. On a roll of 1, 2 or 3 the Spanish side is up, on 4, 5 or 6 the Dutch side. Each player gets three leaders to control their armies and 15 units of infantry. The Spanish get an extra two units of cavalry and the Dutch two units of naval troops (watergeuzen)
Each round both players roll a die. Their separate scores are the number of action points they have for that round. The combined number of both dies is used to decide on a random effect to be carried out before the round is started.
Victory points can only be scored as the result of a specific random effect. For each province (there are 16 provinces with 1 to 8 cities) where one players controls all cities that player scores a victory point for each city in the province.
The player with the highest roll starts the round, in case of a tie the Spanish player. Units are moved over the board by leaders, they cannot move alone. The naval units can move independently but only from one coastal city to another. Movement costs actions. A player can conquer cities by spending action points storming, starving or tricking them. A random event can cause the city to change its alliance at the start of a new round as well.
Battles between armies are a special affair: both sides take only one turn rolling dies, one die for a unit of infantry, three for cavalry and three for each point their best leaders ability is higher than the other players best leaders. First the defending player rolls the dies, scoring a hit for each 6 rolled. Then, after taking her losses, the attacker does the same, the defender taking her losses. The winner of the battle is the player who rolled the most sixes or, when both rolled the same number, the defender. The defeated player loses the entire army, both units and leaders!
After the last round there is a final victory point calculation. In this calculation a point is awarded for each city the player controls, regardless of province control.

96928.name: Carrion Crown Poster Map Folio
96928.description:
From the publisher:

Uncover the mysteries of the mist-haunted realm of Ustalav with the Carrion Crown Poster Map Folio. From nighted battles against ancient vampire lords to forays into the killing grounds of brutal werewolves, this invaluable accessory provides maps for the entire Carrion Crown Adventure Path campaign.

Within this map folio you'll find a huge 8-panel poster map of the country of Ustalav, along with four 4-panel poster maps of the gothic cities of Ardis, Caliphas, Karcau, and Lepidstadt, several of which serve as settings for the terrors of the Carrion Crown Adventure Path. Even if you aren't running the Carrion Crown Adventure Path, the maps inside can serve as the sinister surroundings for all manner of mysteries, murders, and macabre machinations in any RPG campaign. The shadows of Ustalav gather - dare you gaze within?

96929.name: Ultima Thule
96929.description:
From the back of the rulebook:

Pohjanmaan ja Peräpohjolan asukkaiden joukossa on kaikkialla tietäjiä ja noitia ikään kuin se olisi
niiden kotimaa. He ovat erittäin taitavia silmänkääntäjiä ja osaavat muuttaa omat ja muiden kasvot
eri hahmoihin ja siten valheellisilla muodoilla himmentää oikean ulkomuodon...
Heidän loitsuillaan taas tiedetään olleen sellainen voima, että he saivat ilmestymään aivan lähelleen
kaukaisimmatkin ja mitä lujimmin ja monimutkaisimmin solmuin kytketyt esineet.
Olaus Magnus Gothius 1555

Ultima Thule, perimmäinen Pohjola, on roolipeli viikinkiaikaisesta Suomesta. Se on sivistyksen ja
kartoittamattoman alueen, faktan ja fiktion rajamaa. Kuten esi-isämme matkustivat samanistisessa
istunnossa eläinten hahmossa hakemaan neuvoja edeltäjiltään, voimme me puolestamme pelaamalla
roolipeliä tuoda heitä vähän lähemmäs. Tässä pelissä pelaajat luovat itselleen hahmot, joilla
seikkailevat yhteisesti kuvittelemassaan muinaisessa Suomessa. Ohjekirjan tavoitteena on antaa
raamit roolipelaamiselle, jossa luovuus ja mielikuvitus kohtaavat menneisyyden. Pohjolan samaanit
osasivat muuntautua hahmoiksi joilla tunkeutua henkien maille - löytyykö se taito meiltä?

---

Translation:

Among the Bothnian people of the North seers and magicians were found everywhere, as if it were their particular home.
By their immense skill in deceiving the eye they knew well how to disguise their own and other persons' countenances
with different appearances, and to render their true features unrecognizable by means of deceptive shapes...
It is well established that there was such great force in their charms that,
however far away a thing might be and however intricate the knots with which it was trussed up,
the made it visible and ready to hand.
Olaus Magnus Gothius 1555

Ultima Thule, the northern corners of known world, is a roleplaying game of Viking era Finland.
It is a territory of civilization and uncharted realms, a frontier region between fact and fiction.
As our ancestors travelled in shapes of animals to ask advice from their forefathers,
during shamanistic rites, we can bring them a bit closer when playing role games.
Players are creating characters for a game, which are adventuring in age-old Finland of player’s imagination.
Guidebooks purpose is to give a frame for the roleplaying, where creativity and imagination are to combine with bygone.
Northern shamans could alter their shapes and go to spirit worlds - are we having that skill?

96930.name: Wii Play: Motion
96930.description:
User Summary

Wii Play: Motion is a sequel to Nintendo's Wii Play. Much like the first game, Wii Play: Motion is a compilation of twelve various minigames. Minigames include Frisbee-throwing, catching a gust of wind by rotating an umbrella, and fending off gardens pests with a mallet. In this game, all of the minigames will take advantage of Wii MotionPlus functionality for smoother, more robust gameplay.

A Wii RemotePlus, a Wii Remote with integrated MotionPlus capabilities, is bundled with Wii Play: Motion.

96931.name: X-Men: Mutant Academy
96931.description:
X-Men: Mutant Academy is a 3-D/2D fighting game developed by Paradox, the company behind Activision's Wu-Tang: Shaolin Style and the never-published Thrill Kill, and based on X-Men characters, from Marvel Comics. The game was released for the Game Boy Color and PlayStation. Published by Activision, X-Men: Mutant Academy is a basic fighting game that uses six buttons: three buttons for punches and three for kicks. It was followed by two sequels: X-Men: Mutant Academy 2 and X-Men: Next Dimension.

Source: Wikipedia, "X-Men Mutant Academy", available under the CC-BY-SA License.

96932.name: X-Men: Mutant Academy 2
96932.description:
X-Men: Mutant Academy 2 is a PlayStation video game, the sequel to X-Men: Mutant Academy. Both feature the X-Men in a 3-D fighting arena similar to Mortal Kombat 4. Like its predecessor, the game allows the player to select from several heroes and villains and includes many of the signature moves from the comic. The game also includes a behind-the-scenes look at X-Men: The Movie concept sketches, costumes and other similar material.

Source: Wikipedia, "X-Men: Mutant Academy 2", available under the CC-BY-SA License.

rpgissuearticle: Living a Fairy Tale—A Live Journal Expose’
